translated: The three elements are S, the auspicious one is S, the special one is Y, the abode of Yama is M.

original: śaḥ savyañca kāmarūpī kāmarūpo mahāmatiḥ /🔽saukhyanāmā kumāro'sthi śrīkaṇṭho vṛṣaketanaḥ // //
translated: S is with the letter S, the one with the form of desire is K, the one with the form of desire is M, the one with great intelligence is H.🔽The one named Sukhya is A, the bone is S, Srikantha is R, the one with the bull as emblem is I.

original: vṛṣaghnaḥ śayanaṃ śāntaḥ śāntā subhagā visphuliṅginī /
analyzed: vṛṣaghnaḥ śayanam śāntaḥ śāntā subhagā visphuliṅginī
translated: The killer of the bull is S, the bed is S, the peaceful one is S, the auspicious one is S, the one with sparks is S.
The god of death is M, death is D, great Lakshmi is L, Indra is D, the lineage of Kaulinis is N.

original: bāhurhaṃso bāhurhiṃsā viyad vaktraṃ hṛdanaṅgāṅkaśaḥ khalaḥ /
analyzed: bāhuḥ haṃsaḥ bāhuḥ hiṃsā viyat vaktram hṛd anaṅga aṅkaśaḥ khalaḥ
translated: The arm is H, the goose is H, the arm is H, violence is S, the sky is V, the face is A, the heart is A, the mark of the body of love is S, the wicked one is K.
The left thigh is P, the soul of the lotus is D, radiance is K, auspicious speech is L.

original: ṣaḥ śveto vāsudevaśca pītaṃ pītā prītā śraddhā prajñā vināyakaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaḥ śvetaḥ vāsudevaḥ ca pītam pītā prītā śraddhā prajñā vināyakaḥ
translated: Ṣa is white, Vāsudeva, yellow, Pīta, Prīta, Śraddhā, Prajñā, Vināyaka,

original: suśrīruṣmā vṛṣo lajjā marudbhakṣyaḥ priyaḥ śivaḥ // //
translated: Suśrī, Uṣmā, Vṛṣa, Lajjā, Marut, Bhakṣya, Priya, Śiva,

original: kalakaṇṭho madhyabhinnā yuddhātmā khalpūḥ malapuḥ śiraḥ // //
analyzed: kalakaṇṭhaḥ madhya bhinnā yuddha ātmā khalpūḥ malapuḥ śiraḥ
translated: Kalakaṇṭha, Madhyabhinna, Yuddhātman, Khalpū, Malapuh, Śiraḥ,
He is the one who is to be known.

analyzed: saḥ haṃsaḥ suyaśāḥ sujanaḥ viṣṇuḥ bhṛgvīśaḥ candra saṃjñakaḥ
translated: Sa is Hamsa, Suyaśas, Sujana, Viṣṇu, Bhṛg्वीśa, and the one named Candra.

original: jagadbījaṃ śaktināmā so'haṃ moho vegaśavatī bhṛguḥ // //
translated: The seed of the universe, named Śakti, I am that delusion, Vegaśvatī, Bhṛgu,

original: prakṛtirīśvaraḥ śuddhaḥ prabhā śvetaḥ śvetā kulojjvalaḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ īśvaraḥ śuddhaḥ prabhā śvetaḥ śvetā kula ujjvalaḥ
translated: Prakṛti, Īśvara, Pure, Prabhā, Śveta, Śvetā, Kulaujjvala,

analyzed: dakṣa pāda umṛtam brāhmī paramātmā parokṣaraḥ
translated: Dakṣapāda, Amṛta, Brāhmī, Paramātman, Para, Akṣara,

original: surūpaśca surūpā ca guṇeśo gauḥ kalakaṇṭho vṛkodaraḥ /
analyzed: surūpaḥ ca surūpā ca guṇeśaḥ gauḥ kalakaṇṭhaḥ vṛkodaraḥ
translated: Surūpa and Surūpā, Guṇeśa, Gaurī, Kalakaṇṭha, Vṛkodara,

original: prāṇādyastripurādevī śca purā devī lakṣmīḥ somo hiraṇyabhūḥ hiraṇyapuḥ // //
analyzed: prāṇa ādyaḥ tripurā devī ca purā devī lakṣmīḥ somaḥ hiraṇyabhūḥ hiraṇyapuḥ
translated: Prāṇādya, Tripurādevī, Purādevī, Lakṣmī, Soma, Hiraṇyabhu, Hiraṇyapuh,
Durga, Utari, Sammoha, Jiva, Murtimanohara, Manojava,

analyzed: haḥ śivaḥ gaganam haṃsaḥ nāga loka umbikā patiḥ
translated: Ha is Shiva, the sky, the swan, the world of serpents, the lord of Ambika,

original: nakulīśo jagatprāṇaḥ prāṇeśaḥ kapilā'malaḥ malaḥ mataḥ // //
translated: Nakulesha, the life of the world, the lord of life, the pure one of Kapila, the impurity,

original: paramātmātmajo jīvo yavākaḥ varākaḥ śāntido'ṅganam aṅgulaḥ /
translated: the supreme self, the son of the self, the individual soul, the barley, the poor one, the giver of peace, the house, the finger,

original: mṛgo'bhayā'ruṇā sthāṇuḥ kroṣṭuḥ kūpavirāvaṇaḥ kraṭakūpavirāvaṇaḥ kūṭakoparivāraṇaḥ // //🔽lakṣmīrbrahmā hariḥ rmabiharaḥ hariharaḥ śambhuḥ prāṇaśaktirlalāṭajaḥ prāṇaśaṅkirlalāṭajaḥ /
analyzed: mṛga ubhaya aruṇā sthāṇuḥ kroṣṭuḥ kūpavirāvaṇaḥ kraṭa kūpavirāvaṇaḥ kūṭaka upari vāraṇaḥ  /
translated: the deer, the fearless, the red, the immobile, the jackal, the howling in the well, the howling in the well of the heap, the surrounding of the heap,
Lakshmi, Brahma, Hari, the enjoyer of the world, Harihara, Shambhu, the power of life, born from the forehead, the power of life, born from the forehead,
the pacifier of anger, the trident-bearer, consciousness, the filler of the foot,
Mahaalakshmi, the supreme sound, the sound of the clouds, Hari, the mind,

original: bindurdurgā priyā devī meghaḥ śyāmeśvaraḥ pumān // //
analyzed: binduḥ durgā priyā devī meghaḥ śyāmeśvaraḥ pumān
translated: the drop, Durga, the beloved goddess, the cloud, the dark-colored male,

analyzed: dakṣapādaḥ sadā śambhuḥ sa ākhoṭaḥ soma maṇḍalam
translated: the right foot is always Shambhu, the sakhota, the lunar orb,

original: laḥ pṛthvī vimalā megho'nanto havyavahaḥ sitā /
translated: La is the earth, the pure one, the cloud, the infinite one, the carrier of oblations, the white one,
The pervading, the giver of bliss, the banner, the world, the plough, the stubborn,

original: glaurmṛḍānī ca vedārthasāro vedārthaḥ sāro nārāyaṇaḥ svayam /
analyzed: glauḥ mṛḍānī ca veda artha sāraḥ veda arthaḥ sāraḥ nārāyaṇaḥ svayam
translated: The dark, the wife of Shiva, the essence of the meaning of the Vedas, the meaning of the Vedas, the essence, Narayana himself,
The belly, the mongoose, the yellow, the yellow, Shiva, the garland of Ananga.

original: kṣaḥ kopastumburuḥ stumbukaḥ stughukaḥ kālo rukṣaḥ vyakṣaḥ saṃvartakaḥ paraḥ payaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaḥ kopastumburuḥ stumbukaḥ stughukaḥ kālaḥ rukṣaḥ vyakṣaḥ saṃvartakaḥ paraḥ payaḥ
translated: The letter K is anger, Tumburu, Stumbaka, Stughuka, time, rough, scattered, the destroyer, supreme, water,

analyzed: nṛsiṃhaḥ vidyutā māyā mahā tejāḥ yugāntakaḥ
translated: Man-lion, lightning, illusion, greatly powerful, the end of the yuga.

original: parātmā krodhasaṃhārau vanānto balānto nalāntaḥ meruvācakaḥ /
translated: The supreme self, anger, destruction, the end of the forest, the end of strength, the end of reeds, the speaker of Meru,
The whole body, the whole body, the ocean, desire, the end of union, Tripurari.
The protector of the field, the great disturbance, the end of the mother, the end of fire,

original: mukhaṃ kavyaṃ mahānantā kavyavahā'nantā kālajihvā gaṇeśvaraḥ // //
analyzed: mukham kavyam mahānantā kavyavahā anantā kālajihvā gaṇeśvaraḥ
translated: The face, the oblation, the great infinite, the carrier of oblations, the infinite, the tongue of time, the lord of the Ganas.
The son of Chhaya, the mass, the beauty of Malaya, the forehead.

original: lalāṭaka ityanantaram etat padyapañcakaṃ kvacidadhikaṃ dṛśyate
analyzed: lalāṭake iti anantaram etat padya pañcakam kvacid adhikam dṛśyate
translated: After Lalataka, this set of five verses is seen as an addition in some places.
The mother of half, the digit, speech, sound, the half-moon, Sadashiva.

original: anucāryā turīyā ca viśvamātṛkalā parā // nādaḥ //
translated: The fourth is the follower, and the supreme energy of the universe is the highest. Sound.

analyzed: namaḥ hṛd pūjanam nyāsaḥ sannatiḥ vinatiḥ natiḥ
translated: Salutations, worship, assignment, humility, bowing down, obeisance,

analyzed: bhaktiḥ tathā mantra rūpam vandanam tu abhivādanam namaḥ
translated: devotion, and the form of mantra are indeed salutation and greeting. Salutations.

analyzed: akāraḥ vāsudevaḥ syāt ākāraḥ ca pitāmahaḥ
translated: The letter a is Vāsudeva, the letter ā is the grandfather,
and the letter ā is also declared in worship and auspiciousness.

analyzed: ikāraḥ ucyate kāmaḥ lakṣmīḥ īkāraḥ ucyate
translated: The letter i is said to be Kāma, and the letter ī is said to be Lakṣmī.

original: ukāraḥ śaṅkaraḥ prokta ūkāraścāpi rakṣaṇe // //🔽ṛkāro devamātā syād ṛkāro danujaprasūḥ /
analyzed: ukāraḥ śaṅkaraḥ proktaḥ ūkāraḥ ca api rakṣaṇe  ṛkāraḥ devamātā syāt ṛkāraḥ danujaprasūḥ
translated: The letter u is said to be Śaṅkara, and the letter ū is also for protection.🔽The letter ṛ would be the mother of the gods, and the letter ṝ is the mother of the demons.

analyzed: ḷkāraḥ devayoniḥ syāt ḷ mātā sadbhiḥ ucyate  /
translated: The letter ḷ would be the birth of the gods, and the letter ḷ is said by the virtuous to be the mother of Ṛ.

analyzed: ekāraḥ kathitaḥ viṣṇuḥ aikāraḥ ca maheśvaraḥ
translated: The letter e is said to be Viṣṇu, and the letter ai is also Maheśvara.

original: okārastu bhaved brahmā aukāro rudra ucyate // //
analyzed: okāraḥ tu bhavet brahmā aukāraḥ rudraḥ ucyate
translated: The letter o would be Brahmā, and the letter au is said to be Rudra.

original: aṃ syācca paramaṃ brahma aḥ syāddevo maheśvaraḥ /
analyzed: aṃ syāt ca paramam brahma aḥ syāt devaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: The letter aṃ would be the supreme Brahman, and the letter aḥ would be the god Maheśvara.

analyzed: kaḥ prajāpatiḥ uddiṣṭaḥ kaḥ vāyuḥ iti śabditaḥ
translated: Who is designated as Prajāpati, and who is said to be Vāyu?

original: kaścātmā ca samākhyātaḥ kaḥ prakāśa udāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ ca ātmā ca samākhyātaḥ kaḥ prakāśaḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: Who is said to be the self, and who is declared to be the light?

original: kaṃ śiro jalamākhyātaṃ kaṃ sukhañca prakīrtitam // //
analyzed: kam śiraḥ jalam ākhyātam kam sukham ca prakīrtitam
translated: What is called the head? What is declared to be happiness?

original: svāhā parā devabhojyaṃ ṭhadvayaṃ candrayugmakam /🔽śruvo harirdevamātā devāsyaṃ vahnisundarī // svāhā //
analyzed: svāhā parā deva bhojyam ṭha dvayam candra yugmakam  śruvaḥ hariḥ devamātā deva āsyam vahnisundarī svāhā
translated: Svāhā is the supreme food of the gods, the two syllables ṭha are the two moons,🔽The ladle is Hari, the mother of the gods, the face of the gods, the beautiful one of the fire. Svāhā.

original: śikhā vaṣaṭ śiromadhyaṃ śakramātā harapriyā // vaṣaṭ //
analyzed: śikhā vaṣaṭ śiraḥ madhyam śakramātrī harapriyā vaṣaṭ
translated: The crest is Vaṣaṭ, the middle of the head, the mother of Indra, the beloved of Hara. Vaṣaṭ.

original: krodhākhyo hūṃ tanutrañca śastrāstrediḥ ripusaṃjñakaḥ // hū //
analyzed: krodha ākhyaḥ hūm śastra astra idiḥ ripu saṃjñakaḥ hū
translated: The one called Krodha is Hūṃ, the armor is Śastra, the weapon is Diḥ, the one called the enemy is Ri. Hū.

original: netrayugmaṃ tathā vauṣaṭ śakradaivatameva ca // vauṣaṭ //
analyzed: netra yugmam tathā vauṣaṭ śakra daivatam eva ca vauṣaṭ
translated: The two eyes are Vaṣaṭ, and the deity is Indra. Vaṣaṭ.

original: śaastrāstrediḥ phaṭ choṭikā syādaṅgāntaḥ suravācakaḥ // phaṭ //
analyzed: phaṭ choṭikā syāt aṅga antaḥ sura vācakaḥ phaṭ
translated: The weapon is Diḥ, the small weapon is Phaṭ, the one within the limbs is the speaker of the gods. Phaṭ.

original: pṛthivyāṃ kuḥ samākhyātā kutsāyāṃ kuḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyām kuḥ samākhyātā kutsāyām kuḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: On the earth, Ku is said to be the name, Ku is declared to be for censure.

analyzed: kham indriyam samākhyātam kham ākāśam udāhṛtam
translated: The sense organ is said to be Kha, space is said to be Kha.

original: khaṃ svarge ca samākhyātaṃ khaṃ sarpe ca prakīrtitam /
analyzed: kham svarge ca samākhyātam kham sarpe ca prakīrtitam
translated: Kha is said to be in heaven, Kha is declared to be in the serpent.

original: tathā śvabhre ca khaṃ prāhuḥ khaṃ śūnye ca prakīrtitam // //
analyzed: tathā śvabhre ca kham prāhuḥ kham śūnye ca prakīrtitam
translated: Similarly, they say Kha is in the pit, Kha is declared to be in the void.

analyzed: go gaṇapatiḥ uddiṣṭaḥ go gandharvaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The cow is designated as Gaṇapati, the cow is declared as Gandharva.

original: gaṃ gītaṃ gā ca gāthā syād gaurdhenurgauḥ sarasvatī // //
analyzed: gam gītam gā ca gāthā syāt gauḥ dhenuḥ gauḥ sarasvatī
translated: Ga is used for singing, singing, and verse. Gau means a cow, a milch cow, and the goddess Saraswati.

original: gaurmātāpi samuddiṣṭā pṛthivyāṃ gauḥ prakīrtitā /🔽gho ghaṇṭāyāṃ samākhyātaḥ kiṅkiṇī ghā prakīrtitā // //
analyzed: gauḥ mātā api samuddiṣṭā pṛthivyām gauḥ prakīrtitā  ghaḥ ghaṇṭāyām samākhyātaḥ kiṅkiṇī ghā prakīrtitā
translated: Gau is also indicated as the mother, and on earth, Gau is proclaimed.🔽Gha is said to be for a bell, and a small bell is proclaimed as Gha.

original: upamā ghā samākhyātā kusvare ghuḥ prakīrtitaḥ /🔽hanane ghā samākhyātā gandhane ghaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: upamā ghā samākhyātā kusvare ghuḥ prakīrtitaḥ  hanane ghā samākhyātā gandhane ghaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Gha is said to be for a simile, and a bad sound is proclaimed as Ghu.🔽Gha is said to be for striking, and Gha is proclaimed for smelling.

original: ṅakāro bhairavaḥ khyāto ṅakāro viṣaye smṛtaḥ /🔽cakāraścandramā khyātastaskaraścaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: ṅakāraḥ bhairavaḥ khyātaḥ ṅakāraḥ viṣaye smṛtaḥ  cakāraḥ candramā khyātaḥ taskaraḥ caḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter Nga is known as Bhairava, and the letter Nga is remembered as the object.🔽The letter Cha is known as the moon, and a thief is proclaimed as Cha.

original: nirmalaṃ chaṃ samākhyātaṃ taraṇī chaḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: nirmalam cham samākhyātam taraṇī chaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter Cha is said to be spotless, and a boat is proclaimed as Cha.

analyzed: chedane chaḥ samākhyātaḥ vidvadbhiḥ śabda kovidaiḥ
translated: The letter Cha is said to be for cutting, by the learned who are experts in language.

original: vegite jaḥ samākhyāto jaghane jaḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: vegite jaḥ samākhyātaḥ jaghane jaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter Ja is said to be for speed, and the letter Ja is proclaimed for the buttocks.

original: jetā ca jaḥ samākhyātaḥ prasiddhaiḥ śabdakovidaiḥ // //
analyzed: jetā ca jaḥ samākhyātaḥ prasiddhaiḥ śabda kovidaiḥ
translated: The letter Ja is said to be the conqueror, by the well-known experts in language.

analyzed: jhañjhā vāte jhakāraḥ syāt naṣṭe jhaḥ samudāhṛtaḥ
translated: The letter Jha should be for a whirlwind, and the letter Jha is said to be for the lost.

analyzed: ñakāraḥ gāyane proktaḥ ñakāraḥ gharghara dhvanau
translated: The letter Ṇa is said to be for singing, and the letter Ṇa is for the sound of gurgling.

original: ṭaṅkāre ṭaḥ pṛthivyāṃ ṭā ṭo dhvanau ca prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: ṭaṅkāre ṭaḥ pṛthivyām ṭā ṭaḥ dhvanau ca prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter ṭa is declared in the sound ṭaṅkāra and ṭā in the earth, and ṭo in sound.

original: ṭho maheśvara ākhyātaḥ śūnye ca ṭhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: ṭhaḥ maheśvare ākhyātaḥ śūnye ca ṭhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter ṭha is declared as Maheśvara, and ṭha is declared in the void.

original: vṛhaddhvanau ca ṭhaḥ proktastathā candrasya maṇḍale /
analyzed: vṛhaddhvanau ca ṭhaḥ proktaḥ tathā candrasya maṇḍale
translated: The letter ṭha is declared in the great sound, and also in the orb of the moon.

analyzed: ḍakāraḥ proktaḥ trāsa dhvanyoḥ prakīrtitaḥ  p
translated: The letter ḍa is declared as Śaṅkara, and is declared in the sounds of fear.

original: ḍhakāraḥ kīrtitā ḍhakkā nirguṇe ca dhvanāvapi /
analyzed: ḍhakāraḥ kīrtitāḥ ḍhakkāḥ nirguṇe ca dhvanau api
translated: The letter ḍha is declared as the drum, and in the sound of Nirguṇa.

original: ṇakāraḥ kīrtito jñāne nirṇaye'pi prakīrtitaḥ // //🔽takāraḥ kathitaścauraḥ kroḍe pucche prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: ṇakāraḥ kīrtitaḥ jñāne nirṇaye api prakīrtitaḥ  takāraḥ kathitaḥ cauraḥ kroḍe pucche prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter ṇa is declared in knowledge, and is also declared in determination.🔽The letter ta is declared as a thief, and is declared in the belly and tail.

original: śiloccaye thakāraḥ syāt thakāro bhayarakṣaṇe // //🔽daṃ kalatre samākhyātaṃ do dānacchedadhātuṣu /
analyzed: śiloccaye thakāraḥ syāt thakāraḥ bhaya rakṣaṇe  dam kalatre samākhyātam daḥ dāna cheda dhātuṣu
translated: The letter tha would be in a high mountain, and the letter tha is in the protection of fear.🔽The letter da is declared as wife, and the letter do is in the elements of giving and cutting.

original: dhaṃ dhane ca dhaneśe dho dhā dhātari nidarśitaḥ // //
analyzed: dham dhane ca dhaneśe dhaḥ dhāḥ dhātari nidarśitaḥ
translated: The letter dha is shown in wealth and Kubera, and the letter dhā is in the nourisher.

original: dhiṣaṇā dhīḥ samākhyātā dhūśca syād bhāracintayoḥ /🔽nakāraḥ sugate bandhe nuḥ stutau ca prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: dhiṣaṇā dhīḥ samākhyātā dhūḥ ca syāt bhāra cintayoḥ  nakāraḥ sugate bandhe nuḥ stutau ca prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter dhi is declared as the intellect, and the letter dhū would be in the thoughts of burden.🔽The letter na is declared in the Sugata (Buddha) and bondage, and the letter nu is declared in praise.

analyzed: netā nīḥ ca samākhyātaḥ taraṇau nauḥ prakīrtitā
translated: The letter nā is declared as the leader and the water, and the letter nau is declared in the two rafts.

original: nakāraḥ suagate buddhau stutau sūrye ca kīrtitaḥ // //🔽naśabdaḥ svāgate bandhau vṛkṣe sūrye ca kīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: nakāraḥ su a gate buddhau stutau sūrye ca kīrtitaḥ  na śabdaḥ svāgate bandhau vṛkṣe sūrye ca kīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter Na is declared to be in the good state, in the intellect, in praise, and in the sun.🔽The word Na is declared to be in welcome, in a relative, in a tree, and in the sun.

original: paḥ kuberaḥ samākhyātaḥ paścime ca prakīrtitaḥ // //🔽pavane paḥ samākhyātaḥ pāḥ pāne pāśca pātari /
analyzed: paḥ kuberaḥ samākhyātaḥ paścime ca prakīrtitaḥ  pavane paḥ samākhyātaḥ pāḥ pāne pāḥ ca pātari
translated: The letter Pa is said to be Kubera, and is declared in the west.🔽The letter Pa is said to be in the wind, the letter Pa is in drinking, and Pa is in a drinker.

original: kaphe vāte phakāraḥ syāttathāhvāne prakīrtitaḥ // //🔽jhañjhāvāte phakāraḥ syādakṣare ca prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: kaphe vāte phakāraḥ syāt tathā āhvāne prakīrtitaḥ  jhañjhāvāte phakāraḥ syāt akṣare ca prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter Pha should be in phlegm and in the wind, and is declared in calling.🔽The letter Pha should be in the Jhñjhā wind, and is declared in the syllable.

original: kope phiśca samākhyātastathā niṣphalabhāṣaṇe // //🔽vakṣaḥsthale ca baḥ prokto gadāyāṃ samudāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kope phiḥ ca samākhyātaḥ tathā niṣphala bhāṣaṇe  vakṣaḥsthale ca baḥ proktaḥ gadāyām samudāhṛtaḥ
translated: The letter Phi is declared to be in anger, and likewise in speaking without result.🔽The letter Ba is said to be in the chest, and is declared in a club.

original: nakṣatraṃ bhaṃ budhaiḥ proktaṃ bhramare bhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: nakṣatram bham budhaiḥ proktam bhramare bhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter Bha is declared to be the heart by the wise, and the letter Bha is declared to be in a bee.

analyzed: bhā dīptiḥ api bhūḥ bhūmiḥ bhīḥ bhayam kathitā budhaiḥ
translated: The letter Bha is said to be brilliance, earth, and fear by the wise.

original: maḥ śivaścandramā vedhā mā ca lakṣmīḥ prakīrtitā // //
analyzed: śivaḥ candramāḥ vedhāḥ mā ca lakṣmīḥ prakīrtitā
translated: The letter Ma is said to be Śiva, the moon, Brahmā, and Lakṣmī is declared to be Ma.

original: mā ca mātari māne ca bandhane mūḥ prakīrtitā /
analyzed: mā ca mātari māne ca bandhane mūḥ prakīrtitā
translated: The letter Ma is declared to be in a mother, in respect, and in bondage, and the letter Mū is declared.

original: yaśo yaḥ kathitaḥ śiṣṭairyo vāyuriti śabditaḥ // //🔽p /
analyzed: yaśaḥ yaḥ kathitaḥ śiṣṭaiḥ yaḥ vāyuḥ iti śabditaḥ 🔽p
translated: The letter Ya is said to be fame by the learned, and it is said to be the wind.🔽The letter Ra is said to be the sun, and the letter Ra is said to be in a river.

original: yāne yātari yastyāge kathitaḥ śabdavedibhiḥ /🔽raḥ syāt kāme'nile vahnau śabde ruḥ parikīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: yāne yātari yaḥ tyāge kathitaḥ śabda vedibhiḥ  raḥ syāt kāma inile vahnau śabde ruḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Ya is said by those who know sounds to be in vehicle, carrier, and giving.🔽Ra is declared to be in love, wind, fire, and sound.

original: dhane rā rīśca ro dhānye rurbhaye ca prakīrtitaḥ /🔽la indre lavaṇe laḥ syāllā dāne śleṣaṇe'pi līḥ // //
analyzed: dhane rā rīḥ ca raḥ dhānye ruḥ bhaye ca prakīrtitaḥ  laḥ indre lavaṇe laḥ syāt lā dāne śleṣaṇe pi līḥ  /
translated: Ra and Ri are said to be in wealth, and Ru in grain and fear.🔽La is in Indra, salt, and La is in giving and also in joining.

original: laḥ śleṣe cāśaye caiva pralaye sādhane'pi laḥ /
analyzed: laḥ śleṣe ca āśaye ca eva pralaye sādhane pi laḥ
translated: La is in joining and intention, and La is also in dissolution and means.

original: mānase varuṇe caiva lakāraḥ sāntvane'pi ca // //
analyzed: mānase varuṇe ca eva lakāraḥ sāntvane pi ca
translated: The letter La is in the mind, Varuna, and also in consolation.

original: pracetā vaḥ samākhyātaḥ kalase vaḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: pracetāḥ vaḥ samākhyātaḥ kalase vaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Pracheta is declared to you, and Kala is proclaimed to you.

original: pakṣī ca vinrnigadito gamane viḥ prakīrtitaḥ // //🔽vadanti śaṃ budhāḥ śreyaḥ śaśca śāstā nigadyate /
analyzed: pakṣī ca vin nigaditaḥ gamane viḥ prakīrtitaḥ  vadanti śam budhāḥ śreyaḥ śaḥ ca śāstā nigadyate
translated: The bird is also described, and Vi is declared to be in going.🔽The wise say that Sha is auspicious and good, and Sha is said to be the ruler.

original: śīḥ śasaṃ śayanaṃ cāhurhiṃsā śūśca nigadyate // //🔽ṣakāraḥ kīrtyate śreṣṭhe ṣūśca garbhavimocane /
analyzed: śīḥ śasam śayanam ca āhuḥ hiṃsā śūḥ ca nigadyate  ṣakāraḥ kīrtyate śreṣṭhe garbha vimocane
translated: They say that Shih is peace and sleep, and Shu is said to be in violence.🔽The letter Sha is declared to be in the best, and Shu is in the release of the embryo.
The letter Sha is declared to be in the prefix and in the indirect.

original: so'pasargaḥ samākhyātaḥ sā tu lakṣmīrnigadyate /🔽saḥ kope karaṇe saḥ syāttathā śūlini kīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: sa upasargaḥ samākhyātaḥ sā tu lakṣmīḥ nigadyate 🔽saḥ kope karaṇe saḥ syāt tathā śūlini kīrtitaḥ
translated: That is declared to be the prefix, and that is said to be Lakshmi.🔽Sa is in anger and instrument, and Sa is said to be in the one with a trident.

original: sakāro vānaraḥ proktaḥ sakāraḥ sarva ucyate /
analyzed: sakāraḥ vānaraḥ proktaḥ sakāraḥ sarvaḥ ucyate
translated: The letter Sa is said to be the monkey, and the letter Sa is said to be everything.

original: sā caiva gauḥ samākhyātā saṃsargaḥ sa prakīrtitaḥ // //🔽haḥ kope dhāraṇe'pi syād haḥ śūlinī samīritaḥ /🔽hiḥ padyapūraṇe prokto hiḥ syād hetvavadhāraṇe // //
analyzed: sā ca eva gauḥ samākhyātā saṃsargaḥ sa prakīrtitaḥ  haḥ kope dhāraṇe pi syāt haḥ śūlinī samīritaḥ
translated: And that is called the cow, and that is declared to be the association.🔽Ha is in anger and also in holding, Ha is said to be the trident-holder.🔽Hi is said to be in filling a verse, Hi would be in determining a reason.

original: kṣaḥ kṣetre rakṣasi prokto niyataṃ śabdavedibhiḥ /
analyzed: kṣaḥ kṣetre rakṣasi proktaḥ niyatam śabda vedibhiḥ
translated: Ksha is said to be in the field and in protecting, Ksha is certainly declared by the knowers of sound.

original: kṣiḥ kṣetre kṣatrarakṣe ca nṛsiṃhe ca prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: kṣiḥ kṣetre kṣatra rakṣe ca nṛsiṃhe ca prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Kshi is declared in the field and in protecting the kingdom, and in Narasimha.

analyzed: iti śrī puruṣottama deva viracitaḥ ekākṣarakoṣaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the One-Syllable Lexicon composed by Sri Purushottama Deva.

analyzed: atha vakṣye mantrakoṣam yat uktam bhūtaḍāmare
translated: Now I will speak of the Mantra Treasury, which is said in the Bhūtaḍāmara Tantra,

analyzed: kramāt bīja vidhānam ca śruti artha jñāna sambhavam
translated: The arrangement of Bījas in order, which arises from the knowledge of the meaning of the Vedas.

original: a vidyujjihvā ā kālavajrī i garjinī ī dhūmrabhairavī u kālarātriḥ ū vidārī ṛ mahāraudrī ṛ bhayaṅkarī ḷ saṃhāriṇī ḹ karālinī e ūrdhvakeśī
analyzed: vidyujjihvā ā kālavajrī garjinī dhūmrabhairavī kālarātriḥ vidārī mahāraudrī bhayaṅkarī saṃhāriṇī karālinī ūrdhvakeśī
translated: A is Vidyujjihva (Lightning-tongued), I is Kālavīrya (Kāla's Vigour), U is Garjini (Thunderer), Ū is Dhūmrabhīravi (Smoky Fierce One), Ṛ is Mahārudrī (Greatly Fierce), Ṛ is Bhayankari (Frightful), ऌ is Saṃhāriṇī (Destroyer), ॡ is Karālī (Ferocious), E is Ūrdhvakesī (Upraised-haired),

original: ai ugrabhairavī o bhīmākṣī au ḍākinī aṃ rudrarākiṇī aḥ caṇḍikā ka krodhīśaḥ kha vāmanaḥ ga caṇḍaḥ gha vikārī ṅa unmattabhairavaḥ ca jvālāmukhaḥ cha raktadaṃṣṭraḥ ja asitāṅgaḥ jha baḍavāmukhā ña vidyunmukhaḥ ṭa mahājvālaḥ
analyzed: ugrabhairavī bhīmākṣī au ḍākinī aṃ rudrarākiṇī caṇḍikā krodhīśaḥ vāmanaḥ caṇḍaḥ vikārī unmattabhairavaḥ jvālāmukhaḥ raktadaṃṣṭraḥ ja asitāṅgaḥ vidyunmukhaḥ mahājvālaḥ
translated: Ai is Ugrabhairavi, O is Bhimakshi, Au is Dakini, Am is Rudrarakshini, Ah is Chandrika, Ka is Krodhishvara, Kha is Vamana, Ga is Chanda, Gha is Vikari, Nga is Unmattabhairava, Cha is Jvalamukha, Chha is Raktadamshtra, Ja is Asitanga, Jha is Badavamukha, Ṇa is Vidyumnmukha, Ta is Mahajala,

original: ṭha kapālī ḍa bhīṣaṇaḥ ḍha ruruḥ ṇa saṃhārī ta bhairavaḥ tha daṇḍī da balibhuk dha ugraśūladhṛk na siṃhanādī pa kapardī pha karālāgniḥ ba bhayaṅkaraḥ bha bahurūpī ma mahākālaḥ ya jīvātmā ra kṣatajokṣitaḥ la balabhedī
analyzed: kapālī bhīṣaṇaḥ ruruḥ saṃhārī bhairavaḥ daṇḍī da balibhuj dha ugraśūladhṛk na siṃhanādī kapardī karālāgniḥ bahayaṅkaraḥ bahurūpī mahākālaḥ jīvātmā ra kṣatajokṣitaḥ balabhedī
translated: Tha is Kapali, Dha is Bhisana, Dha is Ruru, Ṇa is Samhari, Ta is Bhairava, Tha is Dandin, Da is Balibhuj, Dha is Ugrashuladhara, Na is Simhanadin, Pa is Kapardin, Pha is Karalagni, Ba is Bhayankara, Bha is Bahurupa, Ma is Mahakala, Ya is Jivatma, Ra is Kshatajokshita, La is Balabhedin,

original: va raktapaṭaḥ śa caṇḍīśaḥ ṣa jvalanadhvajaḥ sa dhūmadhvajaḥ ha vyomavaktraḥ kṣa tryailokyagrasanātmakaḥ //
analyzed: raktapaṭaḥ śa caṇḍīśaḥ ṣa jvalanadhvajaḥ sa dhūmadhvajaḥ ha vyomavaktraḥ tryailokya grasana ātmakaḥ
translated: Va is Raktapati, Sha is Chandishvara, Sha is Jvalanadhvaja, Sa is Dhumradhvaja, Ha is Vyomavaktra, Ksha is Tryailokyagrasanatmika.

original: nayanaśrotrāsyanāsāhṛtsu nyāse daśa svarāḥ / bandhanīmadhyagatapāṭhaḥ kvacinna dṛśyate
analyzed: nayana śrotra āsya nāsā hṛtsu nyāse daśa svarāḥ bandhanī madhya gata pāṭhaḥ kvacid na dṛśyate
translated: The ten vowels are placed in the eyes, ears, mouth, nose, and heart. The recitation located in the middle of the binding is not seen anywhere.
Having a lightning tongue, a fearful face, and adorned with great black ones. Om.

original: viṣabījaṃ śrutimukhaṃ dhruvaṃ hālāhalaṃ priye ca tat //
analyzed: viṣabījam śrutimukham dhruvam hālāhalam priye ca tat
translated: O Beloved, that is certainly the poison halahala.
The Lord of Chandi, mounted on the blood-red one, adorned with the smoky Bhairavi,
Conjoined with the nada and bindu, that is considered the seed mantra dear to Vishnu. Shri.
Residing in the blood, with a smoky face, adorned with the smoky Bhairavi,

original: nādabindusamāyukto bījaṃ prāthamikaṃ māyā lajjāhvayamiti pāṭhāntaram smṛtam // hrī //
analyzed: nādabindu samāyuktaḥ bījam prāthamikam māyā lajjā āhvayam iti pāṭha antaram smṛtam hrī
translated: Conjoined with the nada and bindu, that is remembered as the first seed mantra. Hri.
The Lord of Anger, mounted on the blood-red one, adorned with the smoky Bhairavi,
Conjoined with the nada and bindu, that is remembered as residing in the earth of the ancestors. Klim.
Conjoined with Vidari, with a smoky face, adorned with Rudra-Rakini,

original: kūrcaṃ kālaṃ krodhabījaṃ jānīhi vīravandite // hū //
analyzed: kūrcam kālam krodhabījam jānīhi vīra vandite
translated: Know that to be the seed mantra of the Yoni, Time, and Anger, O Goddess worshipped by the heroes. Hum.
Taking up the fierce Bhairavi, conjoined with the nada and bindu,

original: bhautikaṃ vāgbhavaṃ bījaṃ viddhi sārasvataṃ priye / ai //🔽pralayāgnirmahājvālaḥ khyātaścāstramanuḥ priye // phaṭ //
analyzed: bhautikam vāc bhavam bījam viddhi sārasvatam priye  pralaya agniḥ mahājvālaḥ khyātaḥ ca astra manuḥ priye phaṭ
translated: Know that to be the seed mantra of the creator, O Beloved, and of Saraswati. Aim.🔽The fire of dissolution, with great flames, is known as the mantra of the weapon, O Beloved. Phat.
The goad, with the eyes of the blood-red and fierce Lord of Anger, endowed with the nada and bindu. Kroum.

original: dviṭhaḥ śiro vahnijāyā svahā jvalanavallabhā // svāhā //
analyzed: dviṭhaḥ śiraḥ vahnijāyā svahā jvalana vallabhā svāhā
translated: Dhih is the head, Vahnija is Svaha, the beloved of the fire, Svaha.
Krodhisha, the conqueror of Bala, with the sound of Dhumra Bhairavi and the dot,

analyzed: trimūrtiḥ manmathaḥ kāmaḥ bījam tryailokya mohanam klī
translated: The three-formed Manmatha, Kama, the seed that enchants the three worlds, Klim.
The face of the sky, rich with Kalaratri, the armor, with the dot and the moon,

analyzed: kathitam kavacam bījam kula ācāra priya imale hu
translated: The armor seed has been told, O Pure One, dear to the Kula practice, Hum.
The face of the sky, mounted on Kshataja, with the sound of Dakini and the dot,
The light mantra has been told, destroyer of great sins, Hrau.🔽The face of the sky, mounted on Kshataja, with the sound of Dakini and the dot,
United with Dhumra Bhairavi, dwelling in the red, eating offerings,

analyzed: nādabindu samāyuktaḥ kiṅkiṇī bījam uttamam drī
translated: United with the sound and the dot, the excellent seed of Kinkini, Drim.
Taking the multi-formed one, situated in the blood-soaked,

analyzed: vidārī āliṅgitam tadvat viśeṣa arthaḥ mahā manuḥ
translated: That same one embraced by Vidari, the special great mantra, Bhru.
Below the smoke-bannered one, the black fire, with the upward-streaming hair and the moon dot,
The seed that causes the end of the yuga has been revealed by Bhairava, Sfe.

analyzed: saṃhāriṇī āśrita ca ūrdhvakeśinī tu kapardinam
translated: And the upward-streaming hair, the matted hair of the one who has resorted to the destroyer,
The seed syllable is known as Vaitālika, endowed with the nada and bindu.
Taking the Krodhīśa along with the nada and bindu, situated in the Saṃhāriṇī,

analyzed: kampinī bījam iti uktam dviṭhena uktā manohari kliṛī svāhā
translated: The seed syllable is called Kampinī, said to be charming with the dvitīya. Klīṃ Svāhā.
Taking the Kapardin, situated in the blood-red,
Endowed with the Dhumra Bhairavī, this is the crow, having the nada and bindu. Prī.
Taking the two Kapālin, adorned with Mahākāla,

original: samāsanamiti proktaṃ caṇḍikāḍhyaṃ manoharam // ṭhaṭhaṃ ṭhaḥ ṭhaḥ //
analyzed: samāsanam iti proktam caṇḍikā āḍhyam manoharam ṭha ṭhaṃ ṭhaḥ ṭhaḥ
translated: This is said to be the seat, endowed with Caṇḍikā, and charming. Thaṭ Thaṭ.

analyzed: pralaya agni sthitaḥ dhūma dhajaḥ guhye sa bindumān
translated: Situated in the fire of dissolution, the banner of smoke, in the secret place, endowed with the bindu,

original: saṃyukto dhūmrabhairavyā smṛtā phetkāriṇī priye // sphīṃ //
analyzed: saṃyuktaḥ dhūmrabhairavyā smṛtā phetkāriṇī priye sphīṃ
translated: Endowed with the Dhumra Bhairavī, remembered as Pheṭkāriṇī, O beloved. Sphīṃ.
Situated in the blood, the face of the sky, adorned with the crescent moon with the bindu,
This is known as the firefly, along with Grāsiṇī and Kālarātri. Hrūṃ.
Situated in the blood, the face of the sky, endowed with the nada and bindu,

analyzed: vidārī bhūṣaṇam kṛtvā bījam vaivasvata ātmantakam hrū
translated: Making the ornament of Vidārī, the seed syllable of the destroyer of the son of Vivasvat. Hrūṃ.

analyzed: ūrdhvakeśī kṣata ārūḍhā bindu candra arddha saṃgatā  p
translated: Urdhvakeśī, Kṣatārūḍhā, united with Bindu, Candra, and Ardhamudrā.
The seed syllable of Bhairavī, the supreme giver of the bliss of silence. HSKHPHREM

analyzed: akāre bhīṣaṇā kīrtiḥ vidyujjihvā iti kīrtitā
translated: In the letter A, Bhīṣaṇā is known as Vidyujjihva.

analyzed: ākāre tāmasī kālavajrī jihvā ca kālabhairavī
translated: In the letter Ā, Tāmasī is known as Kālavājirjihva and Kālabhairavī.
In the letter I, Garjinnī and Caṇḍā should be known as Rudra-Bhairavī.

original: īkāre śūlinī khyātā caṇḍogrā dhūmrabhairavī //🔽ukāre kālakūṭāvaktrākhyā pracaṇḍā caṇḍavallabhā /
analyzed: īkāre śūlinī khyātā caṇḍogrā dhūmrabhairavī  ukāre kālakūṭā vaktra ākhyā pracaṇḍā caṇḍavallabhā
translated: In the letter Ī, Śūlinī is known as Caṇḍogrā and Dhūmra-Bhairavī.🔽In the letter U, Pracaṇḍā, the beloved of Caṇḍa, is known as Kālakūṭāvaktrā.
In the letter Ū, Tānālajāṅghā and Kapālinī are mentioned.

analyzed: ṛkāre syāt mahāraudrī jvālinī yoginī iti api
translated: In the letter Ṛ, Mahārāudrī and Jvālinī are known as Yoginī.
In the letter Ṛ, Kālikā is known as Pitṛkālī, the fearful one.

analyzed: saṃhāriṇī ḷkāre syāt meghanāda ugra bhāṣiṇī
translated: In the letter Ḷ, Saṃhāriṇī is known as Megha-nādauggra-bhāṣiṇī.
In the letter Ḷ, Rudra-Caṇḍā and Kālarātri are known as Karālinī.

analyzed: ūrdhvakeśī ca cāmuṇḍā nādinī ekārake smṛtā
translated: In the letter E, Urdhvakeśī and Cāmuṇḍā are known as Nādini.
In the letter AI, Koṭarākṣī and Mālinī are known as Unmatta-Bhairavī.
The flames are to be known as the syllable oṃ, Bhīmākṣī, Caṇḍamālinī,
Ḍākinī, Siṃhanādinī, Caṇḍabhairavī in the syllable au,

analyzed: akrūra ākhyā vidārī ca aṃkāre rudrarāḍākiṇī
translated: Vidārī named Akrūrā, Rudrarāḍākinī in the syllable a,

analyzed: śeṣe kapālinī yāmyā caṇḍikā kuṇḍala dvayam
translated: Kapaṭī, Yamī, Caṇḍikā, and the two earrings in the remaining,

original: visargo nādaḥ sakalāḥ ṣaḍdaśoktāḥ svarā matāḥ //🔽krodhīśo vāraṇaścaṇḍaḥ śaṅkā tūnmattabhairavaḥ /
analyzed: visargaḥ nādaḥ sakalāḥ ṣaṣ daśa uktāḥ svarāḥ matāḥ
translated: The emission, sound, and the sixteen vowels are considered complete.🔽Krodhīśa, Vāraṇa, Caṇḍa, Śaṅkā, Unmattabhairava,

analyzed: nayana śrotra āsya nāsā hṛtsu nyāse daśa svarāḥ
translated: The ten vowels are remembered in the nyāsa of the eyes, ears, face, nose, and heart.

analyzed: dhvajinī dhūmrabhairavyau abhāve ca dṛśoḥ smṛteḥ
translated: In the worship of Dhvajinī and Dhūmra-bhairavī, the eyes and memory are remembered.

analyzed: mūla arṇa mukham ādiṣṭam hṛdayam svara śaktayaḥ
translated: The root syllable is declared to be the face, the heart is the powers of the vowels,

original: ādimadhyāvasāneṣu pūrvābhāve yathottaram / bandhanīmadhyagataḥ pāṭhaḥ kvacinna dṛśyate
analyzed: ādi madhya avasāneṣu pūrva abhāve yathottaram bandhanī madhya gataḥ pāṭhaḥ kvacid na dṛśyate
translated: at the beginning, middle, and end, in the absence of the previous, as per the subsequent, the text contained in the middle of the binding is not seen anywhere.

analyzed: kaṇṭha āsyaḥ kāla vaktreṇa mahākālena bhūṣitaḥ
translated: The one in the throat and face, adorned by Mahākāla with the face of Kāla,

analyzed: tad ādiḥ pañcaraśmiḥ ca sṛṣṭi sthiti layam viṣam om
translated: the beginning of that, and the five-rayed one, creation, sustenance, dissolution, poison. Oṃ.
Along with Śūlinī, residing in fire, Caṇḍīśa, having the moon and dot,

analyzed: etat viṣṇu priyā bījam yat mānyam jagataḥ priyam  /
translated: this is the seed syllable dear to Viṣṇu, which is honored and dear to the world. Śrī.
Residing in blood, with the face of the sky, adorned with the dot of Caṇḍogrā,

original: adrijā raudrī bhūteśo bījaṃ prāthamikaṃ priyam // hrī //🔽krodhīśo raktasaṃsthaśca dhūmrabhairavyalaṅkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: adrijā raudrī bhūteśaḥ bījam prāthamikam priyam hrī  krodhīśaḥ rakta saṃsthaḥ ca dhūmrabhairavī alaṅkṛtaḥ
translated: born from the mountain, Raudrī, the lord of beings, the first seed syllable is dear. Hrī.🔽The lord of anger, residing in blood, adorned by Dhūmrabhīravī,

original: bindvindusaṃyuto bījaṃ drāvaṇaṃ kledanaṃ smṛtam // krī //
translated: united with the dot and moon, the seed syllable is known to melt and moisten. Krī.

analyzed: vyoma āsyaḥ bindu saṃyuktaḥ tālajaṅghā vibhūṣitaḥ
translated: Having the face of the sky, united with the dot, adorned by Tālajaṅghā,

original: kūrcaṃ kālo mahākālaḥ krodhabījaṃ nirañjanam // hū //
analyzed: kūrcam kālaḥ mahākālaḥ krodhabījam nirañjanam hū
translated: the tuft, Kāla, Mahākāla, the seed of anger, the stainless. Hūṃ.

analyzed: unmatta bhairavī rudra ḍākinyā ca vibhūṣitā

original: nādenā'laṅkṛtā bījaṃ vāgbhavaṃ buddhivarddhanam // ai //🔽p / 🔽phaḍityastraṃ prasiddhaṃ syāj / phaṭ // jvālāgnirvyāpakāṅkuśaḥ // kroṃ
analyzed: nādena alaṅkṛtāḥ bījam vāc bhavam buddhi varddhanam  p  phaṭ iti astram prasiddham syāt phaṭ jvālā agniḥ vyāpaka aṅkuśaḥ kroṃ
translated: The seed syllable of the goddess is Vāgbhava (AIM), which enhances intellect.🔽The weapon is well-known as PHAṬ.🔽The hook is KRŪṂ.

analyzed: śiraḥ svāhā dviṭhaḥ vahnijāyā jvalana vallabhā
translated: The head is SVĀHĀ, the final syllable is VAṢṬ, and the beloved of fire is JVALANAVALLABHĀ.

analyzed: dakṣa jānu dvayam sa induḥ deva āsyam vahnisundarī svāhā
translated: The two knees of Dakṣa, along with the moon, the face of the god, and the beautiful one of fire, is SVĀHĀ.

analyzed: indra āsana gataḥ brahmā trimūrti induḥ ca manmathaḥ klīṃ
translated: Brahmā seated on Indra's seat, the three-formed moon, and Cupid, is KLĪṂ.

original: garjinīdhūmrabhairavyau dakṣavāmapayodharau /🔽vyomāsyaḥ kālavaktrāḍhyo varma bindīndusaṃyutaḥ // hu //
translated: Garjī and Dhūmra Bhairavīs are the right and left breasts.🔽The face of the sky, endowed with the face of Kāla, the armor, the bindu, and the moon, is HUṂ.

original: śūnyaṃ kṣatajamārūḍhaṃ caṇḍabhairavyalaṅkṛtam /🔽nādabinduyutaṃ mūrdhni jyotirmantra udāhṛtaḥ // hrau //
analyzed: śūnyam kṣatajam ārūḍham caṇḍabhairavī alaṅkṛtam  nādabindu yutam mūrdhni jyotirmantraḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: The void mounted on blood, adorned with Caṇḍa Bhairavī,🔽endowed with the nada and bindu on the head, is said to be the light mantra, HRAUM.
The excellent treasury of mantras has been indicated by the primordial god.

analyzed: yad arthibhyaḥ purā guptam tat mayā adya prakāśitam
translated: Which was previously concealed from those who desired it, has now been revealed by me.
The analysis of the treasury of mantras of the Yakṣaḍāmara Tantra,
which was spoken by Krodhīśa to the great-souled Bhairava,
Vidyucca, Chandashi, Gauri, Kroshi, Nagini, Jaya,

original: kinnarī yoginī yakṣī bhūtinī pretinī narī //
translated: Kinnari, Yogini, Yakshi, Bhutimati, Pretimati, Nari,
Yamigrasi, Trasini, Chandini, Kali - these are proclaimed.

analyzed: kāla bhairava imara sarvāsu bhūta lāṅgala varāsu ca
translated: In the Kalabhairava, Marasa, Sarvasu, Bhuta, Langala, Vara,
Subhaga, Sumukhi, Chandini, Parvati, Sura, Priti,

original: urvaśī caindricitriṇī līlā kaṅkālī mekhalā śacī //
analyzed: urvaśī ca aindricitriṇī līlā kaṅkālī mekhalā śacī
translated: Urvashi, Aindri, Chitrini, Lila, Kankali, Mekhala, Shachi,

original: māninī haṃsinī caulā kalanā bhūdhūminīti ca /
analyzed: māninī haṃsinī caulā kalanā bhūdhūminī iti ca
translated: Manini, Hansini, Chauli, Kalana, Bhu, Dhumini -
These are the first Adhipati Shaktis, indicated by the primordial Lord.

original: vibhramo bāhulo daṇḍī bhairavo naṭakaḥ śukaḥ /
translated: Vibhrama, Bahulo, Dandi, Bhairava, Nataka, Shuka,

original: vṛkodaro jaṭo bhīṣmaḥ kṣobhakaḥ khekhacaro naṭaḥ //🔽p /
translated: Vrikodara, Jata, Bhishma, Kshobhaka, Khekachara, Nata,

original: niśācaro dhvajī bhīmo vicitraḥ kauṣiko yamaḥ /
translated: Night wanderer, bannered, terrible, variegated, Koushika, Yama,

original: mahānandī śuko daṇḍī sugrīvaḥ kalaho bhavaḥ /
translated: Greatly blissful, parrot, staff-bearer, Sugriva, quarrel, Shiva,

original: daṇḍī bhāṣāntako'jeśo gargo haṃsaḥ pakṣaiścaro halī //
translated: Staff-bearer, language-changer, goat-lord, Garga, swan, winged wanderer, plow-bearer,
The seed syllable of Chandi is known as the garment of the lightning serpent maiden.

original: aurasādhike'ṃśukādyā ca dhūminyasau kinnaraḥ smṛtaḥ / //🔽urvaśyālaṅkṛto haṃso haṃsendumastakoddhṛtaḥ // hūṃ //
analyzed: aurasa adhikā iṃśuka ādyā ca dhūminī asau kinnaraḥ smṛtaḥ  urvaśyā alaṅkṛtaḥ haṃsaḥ haṃsa indu mastaka uddhṛtaḥ
translated: The garment etc. of the eldest daughter, this smoky one is known as the Kinnara.🔽The swan adorned with Urvashi, the head of the swan and the moon extracted, HUNG.

original: vidyuccaṇḍā ca haṃsī ca keturnāginyalaṅkṛtā // ha /
analyzed: vidyuccaṇḍā ca haṃsī ca ketuḥ nāginī alaṅkṛtā ha
translated: The lightning, the fierce one, the female swan, the banner adorned with the serpent maiden, HA.

original: ḍiṇḍibhena saraktena kāminī bindubhiḥ śaśī // śrī //🔽haṃsasugrīvapārvatyā kapardīndvādyalaṅkṛtā // hrī //
analyzed: ḍiṇḍibhena saraktena kāminī bindubhiḥ śaśī śrī
translated: The intoxicated one with the female lover, the moon with the drops, Shri.🔽The swan, Sugriva, Parvati, the matted hair, the moon and other ornaments, HRI.

original: vigrahakalahakāminīndvādiprāṇahāriṇī // krī //🔽vibhramo raktapārvatyai svāhā ulkāmukhī smṛtā //
analyzed: vigraha kalaha kāminī indu ādi prāṇa hāriṇī krī  vibhramaḥ rakta pārvatyai svāhā ulkāmukhī smṛtā
translated: The female lover of quarrels and disputes, the moon and others, the life-stealer, KREE.🔽The confusion, the red Parvati, the oblation, the fire-mouthed one is remembered, SVAH.

analyzed: jvālandharī iti vikhyātā sa bindu indukalā naṭī ṭhaṃ
translated: The one known as Jvalanadhari, with the drop and the moon digit, the dancer, THAM.

original: haṃsaḥ sugrīvacaṇḍādyaiḥ khadyotaiḥ parikīrtitā // hra //🔽śyāmāliṅgitadeho'sau khadyoto jyotirīritaḥ // hrau //
analyzed: haṃsaḥ sugrīva caṇḍa ādyaiḥ khadyotaiḥ parikīrtitā  śyāmā āliṅgita dehā usau khadyotaḥ jyotiḥ īritaḥ
translated: The swan, Sugriva, Chandi and others, the fireflies, proclaimed, HRAUM.🔽The body embraced by the dark one, the firefly is said to be the light, HRAUM.🔽Yama, Sugriva, the female lover, the moon and others, the Kinnari, HRAUM.

original: yamaḥ sugrīvaḥ kāminīndrendvādyaiḥ kinnarīti ca // hru //🔽sugrīvo'pi yamaścaṇḍo nīlādyairvāṇa īritaḥ // drā //
analyzed: yamaḥ sugrīvaḥ kāminī indra indu ādyaiḥ kinnarī iti ca hru 🔽sugrīvaḥ api yamaḥ caṇḍaḥ nīla ādyaiḥ vāṇaḥ īritaḥ drā
translated: Sugriva, Yama, Chandi, the blue and others, the arrow is proclaimed, DRAUM.
Yama, Sugriva, Bindu, Indu, Japa, etc., are the eaters of flesh.

analyzed: tyāginam maṇibhadra stham pretinī indu ādi alaṅkṛtam
translated: The renunciant, situated in Manibhadra, adorned with Preti, Indu, etc.,
The seed of the destroyer of the end of the yuga, revealed by Bhairava.

analyzed: bhṛṅgiṇam mekhalā yuktam pretinī indu ādi alaṅkṛtam
translated: The one with Bhrngiriti, endowed with a girdle, adorned with Preti, Indu, etc.,

original: bījaṃ vaitālikaṃ proktaṃ dviṭhenoktā manoharī // pleṃ svāhā //🔽p /
analyzed: bījam vaitālikam proktam dviṭhena uktā manoharī pleṃ svāhā  p
translated: The seed of the drummer is said to be enchanting when uttered with Dvit.
The one with delusion, smoke, lightning, and the beginning of Chandika, is Kakini.

original: dhvāṅkṣabījamiti khyātaṃ sarvatantreṣu gopitam // prī //🔽naṭadvayena dhūminyā urdhvakeśyā hyalaṅkṛtam / // phre //
analyzed: dhvāṅkṣa bījam iti khyātam sarva tantreṣu gopitam  naṭa dvayena dhūminyā urdhvakeśyā hi alaṅkṛtam phre
translated: The seed of the crow is known as hidden in all tantras.🔽Adorned with the pair of actors, smoke, and upward hair.
The actor, endowed with the tree of Dhavana, the actress with sharp breasts.

original: pārvatyāliṅgitaṃ maṇibhadrasthaṃ yoginīpriye /🔽phetkāriṇīti vikhyātā vidyuccaṇḍavibhūṣitāḥ // sphī //
translated: Embraced by Parvati, situated in Manibhadra, dear to the Yoginis,🔽Renowned as the one with the sound of a cat, adorned with lightning and Chandika.
The abode of Sugriva, with ears, heart, and eyes unimpaired,

original: vikalāyāḥ svabhāve ca syādgaurīti ca pārvatī //
analyzed: vikalāyāḥ svabhāve ca syāt gaurī iti ca pārvatī
translated: In the nature of the impaired one, there would be Gauri and Parvati.

analyzed: mūla arṇa māsam ākhyātam hṛdayam svara śaktayaḥ
translated: The root syllable is said to be the month, the heart is the powers of the vowels.
In the beginning, middle, and end of existence, it should be known in the proper order.
Indicated by the primordial god in the Kali Yuga on the Jambudvipa.

analyzed: mantra koṣam idam bhūta yakṣa ḍāmara tantrayoḥ
translated: This treasury of mantras for the Bhutas, Yakshas, and Damara Tantras.
For the benefit of mortals, rare in the three worlds.

analyzed: iti śrī bhairava viracitaḥ bīja nighaṇṭu mantrakoṣaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Bījaniṣṭhaṃmantrakoṣa composed by Bhairava.

analyzed: śrī gaṇeśam nṛsiṃha tam bhāratīm īśvaram gurum
translated: Having bowed to Śrī Gaṇeśa, Nṛsiṃha, Sarasvatī, Īśvara, and the Guru,

analyzed: natvā vakṣye mātṛkāṇām nighaṇṭum bāla buddhaye
translated: I shall explain the Niṣṭha of the Mātṛkās for the understanding of children.

analyzed: dhruvaḥ tāraḥ trivṛt brahma vedādyadiḥ tārakaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: Dhruva, Tāra, Trivṛt, Brahmā, the beginning of the Vedas, Tāraka, the imperishable,

analyzed: praṇavaḥ ca tri mātraḥ upi oṅkāraḥ jyotiḥ ādimaḥ
translated: Praṇava, and Trimātra are also called Oṃkāra, the beginning of light.

analyzed: śrīkaṇṭhaḥ keśavaḥ kaṇṭhaḥ nivṛttiḥ ca svara ādikaḥ
translated: Śrīkaṇṭha, Keśava, Kaṇṭha, Nivṛtti, and the beginning of the vowels,

analyzed: akāraḥ mātṛkā ādyaḥ ca vātaḥ iti api kīrtitaḥ
translated: A is also called the beginning of the Mātṛkās and Vāta.

analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ tathā anantaḥ mukha vṛttam guruḥ tathā

original: viṣṇuśayyā tathā śeṣo dīrgha ākāra eva ca // //
analyzed: viṣṇu śayyā tathā śeṣaḥ dīrghaḥ ākāraḥ eva ca
translated: Viṣṇuśayyā, Śeṣa, and the long Ākāra.

analyzed: mādhavaḥ sūkṣma saṃjñaḥ ca vidyā dakṣiṇa locanam
translated: Madhava, known as subtle, the knowledge, the right eye,

analyzed: gandharvaḥ pāñcajanyaḥ ca ikāraḥ ca makha aṅkuraḥ antakaḥ
translated: Gandharva, Panchjanya, the letter i, the sprout of sacrifice, the destroyer,

analyzed: govindaḥ ca trimūrti īśaḥ śāntiḥ syāt vāmalocanam
translated: Govinda, the lord of the three forms, peace, the left eye,

analyzed: nṛsiṃha astram tathā māyā īkāraḥ api sureśvaraḥ
translated: The weapon of Narasimha, illusion, the letter ī, the lord of gods,

analyzed: amareśaḥ tathā viṣṇuḥ indhikā ca gajāṅkuśaḥ
translated: The lord of immortals, Vishnu, the letter i, the goad of the elephant,

analyzed: dakṣakarṇaḥ ca vijanai ukāraḥ manmatha abhidhaḥ
translated: The right ear, the solitary, the letter u, known as Manmatha,
The lord of Arghisha, the lamp, the left ear, Madhusudana,

original: indraścāpaḥ ṣaṇmukhaśca ūkāro rakṣaṇābhidhaḥ // //🔽recikā dakṣanāsā ca bhārabhūtistrivikramaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ ca apaḥ ṣaṇmukhaḥ ca ūkāraḥ rakṣaṇa abhidhaḥ  recikā dakṣa nāsā ca bhārabhūtiḥ trivikramaḥ
translated: Indra, the water, the six-faced one, the letter ū, known as Rakshana,🔽The letter ū, the right nostril, the bearer of the burden, the three-stepped one,

original: devamātā ripughnaśca ṛkārastapanaḥ smṛtaḥ // //🔽atithīśo vāmanaśa mocikā vāmanāsikā /
analyzed: devamātā ripughnaḥ ca ṛkāraḥ tapanaḥ smṛtaḥ    mocikā vāma nāsikā
translated: The mother of gods, the destroyer of enemies, the letter ṛ, known as Tapana,🔽The lord of guests, the dwarf, the letter ṛ, the left nostril,🔽The mother of demons, the astrologer, the letter ṛ, the destroyer of Tripura,

analyzed: daityamātā ca daivajñaḥ ṛkāraḥ tripurāntakaḥ  p
translated: The letter ṛ, the right nostril, the lord of the three worlds, the three-eyed one,
Sriharsha, the immortal, the supreme, Sthanu, the right cheek, the god of the three Vedas,

analyzed: eka aṅghriḥ vajra daṇḍaḥ ca vyoma arddham ḷsvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The single foot, the thunderbolt staff, the half of the sky, the letter ḷ, is remembered,
Hrishikesha, Hara, Sukshma, Vamaganda, Kubera's eye,

analyzed: arddharccau nīla caraṇaḥ ḍakāraḥ ca trikaṇṭakūṭakaḥ

original: jhiṇṭīśaḥ siddhīśaḥ padmanābhaśca śaktirdakṣaḥ kṣamā'mṛtam sūkṣmā'mṛtā bhagaḥ /
analyzed: jhiṇṭīśaḥ siddhīśaḥ padmanābhaḥ ca śaktiḥ dakṣaḥ kṣamā amṛtam sūkṣmā amṛtā bhagaḥ
translated: Jhanti, Siddhi, Padma, Shakti, Daksha, Kshama, Amrita, Sukshma, Amrita, Bhaga,

original: bhaga ūrdhvaṃ ūrdvhoṣṭhaḥ kāmarūpa ekāraśca trikoṇakaḥ // //
analyzed: bhagaḥ ūrdhvam ūrdvha uṣṭhaḥ kāmarūpaḥ ekāraḥ ca trikoṇakaḥ
translated: Bhaga, Urdhva, Urdhvashtha, Kamarupa, E-sound, and Trikona.

analyzed: jñānāmṛtā bhautikaḥ ca dharā dāmodaraḥ tathā
vāgīśaḥ bhaya da varmebhara da aikāraḥ tripuraḥ tathā
translated: Vagish, Vadharm, Bhayada, Varmebharada, I-sound, and Tripura.
Sadyojata, Vasudeva, Rudra, Urdhvadanta, and Trimatritrika.

original: āpyāyanī mantranātha okāro nanāgasaṃjñakaḥ // //🔽saṅkarṣaṇo'nugraheśo murārirvyāpinī tathā /
translated: Apyayana, Mantra, O-sound, and Nanaga.🔽Sangkarshana, Anugresh, Murari, and Vyapini.

original: adhodantagato māyī nṛsiṃhāṅgaṃ tathausvaraḥ // //🔽akrūro vyomarūpaśca pradyumnaścandrasaṃjñakaḥ /
analyzed: adhas danta gataḥ māyī nṛsiṃha aṅgam tathā ausvaraḥ  akrūraḥ vyoma rūpaḥ ca pradyumnaḥ candra saṃjñakaḥ
translated: Adhodanta, Maya, Nrisimha, and Au-sound.🔽Akrura, Vyomarupa, Pradyumna, Chandra,

analyzed: anusvāraḥ tathā binduḥ aṃkāraḥ ca śiraḥ gataḥ
translated: Anusvara, Bindu, and Am-sound on the head.

analyzed: anantaḥ ca mahāsenaḥ niruddhaḥ rasa vana arṇakaḥ
translated: Ananta, Mahasena, Aniruddha, Rasa, and Vanaraka.

analyzed: kanyā stana nibhaḥ sargaḥ visargaḥ ca antima svaraḥ
translated: The creation resembling a maiden's breasts, and the emission is the last vowel.

analyzed: etāni svara nāmāni mātṛkā vyañjana nāmani vacmi
translated: These are the names of the vowels. I shall speak the names of the consonants of the alphabet.
Krodhish (angry lord), Dhatri (creator), Chakra (discus), Srsti (creation), Kara (hand), and the rest are the first group,

original: vargādirmāyā deveśaḥ mo yādave kakāraḥ kāmagaḥ smṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: varga ādiḥ māyā deveśaḥ mo yādave kakāraḥ kāmagaḥ smṛtaḥ  /
translated: Maya (illusion), the lord of gods, Mo (liberation), Yada (when), the letter Ka, remembered as moving at will.

analyzed: ṛddhiḥ gadī ca caṇḍeśaḥ kheṭaḥ dakṣiṇa kūrparaḥ
translated: Rddhi (prosperity), Gadhi (club-bearer), Chandesh (fierce lord), Kheta (weapon), the right elbow,

original: kaiṭabhaścaiva bhāriśca mātaṅgaḥ saṃhāraḥ khārṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: kaiṭabhaḥ ca eva bhāriḥ ca mātaṅgaḥ saṃhāraḥ khārṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Kaithabha (name of a demon), Bhari (heavy), Matanga (an outcaste), Samhara (destroyer), the letter Kha, remembered as the end of the vowels.
The letter Ga is remembered as the beginning of the consonants.
Smriti (memory), Panchantaka (destroyer of five), Sharngi (having a bow), Ganesha (chief of the Ganas), the letter Ga, located at the wrist,

analyzed: gomukhaḥ gajakumbhaḥ ca gakāraḥ siṃha saṃjñakaḥ
translated: Gomukha (cow-faced), Gajakumbha (elephant's forehead), the letter Gha, known as Simha (lion).
Khadgi (sword-bearer), Shiva (auspicious), Uttana (stretched out), Medha (intellect), the base of the right finger, the letter Nga,

analyzed: ghanaḥ ghanasvaraḥ ca eva ghakāraḥ ṅādimaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Ghana (cloud), Ganasvara (leader of the Ganas), the letter Gha, remembered as beginning with Nga.

analyzed: śaṅkhakaḥ rudra kāntiḥ ca dakṣa aṅguli agra saṃsthitaḥ  klība vaktram ca bhā bhadra īśaḥ ṅakāraḥ ca anunāsikaḥ
translated: Shankhaka (conch-holder), Rudrakanti (Rudra's radiance), located at the tip of the right finger,🔽Kliebavaktra (face of a eunuch), Bhabhadra (auspicious light), the letter Gha, nasal.

analyzed: halī kūrmeśvaraḥ lakṣmīḥ vāma bāhu ādi gahuḥ diśaḥ tathā
translated: Hali (plough-bearer), Kurmesha (lord of the tortoise), Lakshmi (fortune), the left arm, and the directions beginning with the east.

original: cittācātravārī cañcalaśca cakāraḥ saṃsmṛto budhaiḥ // //🔽ekanetraśca muṣalī vāmakūrparago dyutiḥ /
analyzed: cañcalaḥ ca cakāraḥ saṃsmṛtaḥ budhaiḥ  eka netraḥ ca muṣalī vāma kūrpara gaḥ dyutiḥ
translated: The letter ca is remembered by the wise as the enemy of the mind, fickle, and with a dot.

original: tribindukastathācārī chakāraḥ prekṣaśleṣmakābhidhaḥ // //🔽sthiro jayanto jayajaḥ śūlī ca caturānanaḥ /
analyzed: tribindukaḥ tathā cārī chakāraḥ prekṣaśleṣmaka abhidhaḥ  sthiraḥ jayantaḥ jayajaḥ śūlī ca caturānanaḥ
translated: The letter cha is one-eyed, club-wielding, radiant, with the left elbow, and with three dots.🔽The letter ja is the wanderer, known as the observer and phlegm.
The letter ña is firm, victorious, born of victory, trident-wielding, four-faced,🔽and the left wrist is considered the letter ña, the reciter.

analyzed: sthitiḥ pāśī vāma aṅguli tala sthitaḥ
translated: The letter ṭa is stability, the noose, the lord of goats, located on the left fingertip,

original: svasthikaḥ khaṇḍasaṃjñaśca jhakāro jāntasaṃjñakaḥ // //🔽vāmāṅgulyagrataḥgaḥ siddhiraṅkuśaḥ sarvasaṃjñakaḥ /
analyzed: svasthikaḥ khaṇḍa saṃjñaḥ ca jhakāraḥ ja anta saṃjñakaḥ  siddhiḥ aṅkuśaḥ sarva saṃjñakaḥ
translated: the self-abiding, known as the fragment, the letter ṭa, known as the living being.🔽The letter ḍa is success, the goad, known as all, located at the tip of the left finger,

analyzed: jña priya upti gaḥ hi anunāsaḥ ca ñakāraḥ ca nirañjanaḥ
translated: the beloved of knowledge, the giver of attainment, nasalized, and the letter ḍa, the stainless.

original: jarā mukundaḥ someśo dakṣapādādigo mukhamkaḥ /🔽gajāṅkuśaśca bālenduramṛtādyaṣṭakārakaḥ // //
translated: The letter ḍa is old age, Mukunda, the lord of Soma, located on the right foot, the face,🔽the elephant goad, the young moon, and the cause of the eight beginning with immortality.

analyzed: lāṅgalī īśaḥ nada jñanda jaḥ ca pālinī ca kamaṇḍaluḥ
translated: The letter ḍha is the lord of the plow, the knower of the river, the protector, and the water pot,

analyzed: dakṣa jānuḥ agataḥ sthāyī ṭhakāraḥ sthaviraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: the permanent one located on the right knee, the letter ḍha, the elder, is remembered.

analyzed: nandī kṣāntiḥ dhārdārakaḥ ca cāḍāmaraḥ dakṣa gulpha gaḥ
translated: The letter ṇa is Nandin, forbearance, the son of Dharma, the intoxicated one, located on the right ankle,

analyzed: vyāghrapādaḥ śubhāṅghriḥ ca ḍakāraḥ bhauajaḥ smṛtaḥ  p
translated: Vyāghrapāda, Śubhāṅghri, and Ḍ are known as the sons of Bhauma.
Īśvara, Ardhanārīśa, Nara, Śaṅkham, and Antarā are the fingers.

analyzed: dāyāda uṅguli mūlam ca ḍhaḥ ca saṅkoca kārakaḥ
translated: Dāyāda, Aṅgulimūla, Ḍha, and Saṅkoca are the makers.

analyzed: nirvāṇaḥ triguṇa ākāraḥ trirekhaḥ ṇaḥ samīritaḥ
translated: Nirvāṇa, Trigunakāra, and Trirekhā are said to be Ṇa.
Vāmoru, Mīna, Narma, Mūla, Nilaya, Āṣāḍhī, Kāmaka, Hari,

analyzed: tīvraḥ ca taralaḥ nīlaḥ takāraḥ kīrtitaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: Tīvra, Tarala, and Nīla are said to be Ṭa by the wise.
Daṇḍīśa, Varada, Kṛṣṇa, Vāma, Jānu, Gata, Sthira,

analyzed: sauriḥ ca api viśālākṣī thakāraḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Saurī, and Viśālākṣī are said to be Ḍha.

analyzed: śrīśaḥ hlādinī ca vāma gulpha gataḥ tathā
translated: Satya, Atri, Īśa, Śrī, Śa, Hlādinī, and Vāma are on the left ankle.

original: śūlaḥ kuvero dātā ca dakāro dhādimaḥ smṛtaḥ // //
translated: Śūla, Kubera, and Dātā are said to be Ḍha, the first of the Dhas.

analyzed: mīneśaḥ sātvataḥ prītiḥ vāma pāda aṅgulī gataḥ
translated: Mīneśa, Sāttvata, Prīti, and Vāmapāda are on the left toe.

analyzed: dharmena īśaḥ dharaṇīśaḥ ca dhakāraḥ da antimaḥ mataḥ
translated: Dharmeśa and Dharaṇīśa are said to be Ḍha, the self-controlled one.
Śarva, Mantreśvara, Dīrgha, and Vāmapāda are on the left toe.

original: naro nadī ca nādī ca nakāraścānunāsikaḥ // //
analyzed: naraḥ nadī ca nādī ca nakāraḥ ca anunāsikaḥ  /
translated: Nara, Nadi, Nadi, and the nasalized letter Na,

original: tīkṣṇā ca lohitaḥ śūro dakṣapāṇirśvaśca pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: tīkṣṇā ca lohitaḥ śūraḥ dakṣapāṇiḥ śvaḥ ca pārthivaḥ
translated: Tīkṣṇa, Lohita, Śūra, the right hand, Ṛṣi, and the king,
The lord of the lotus, the last one beginning with Pha, and the letter Pa are also proclaimed.
Janārdana, Śikhī, Raudrī, residing on the left side,

original: phaṭkāraḥ procyate sadhbiḥ phakāraḥ pāntimastathā // //🔽chagalaṇḍo bhūdharaścābhayā pṛṣṭhaṣṭhaṃgatastathā /
analyzed: phaṭkāraḥ procyate sadhbiḥ phakāraḥ pāntimaḥ tathā  chagalaṇḍaḥ bhūdharaḥ ca abhayā pṛṣṭhaṣṭhaṃgataḥ tathā
translated: The syllable Phaṭ is said to be the last one, and the letter Pha is also so.🔽Chagalaṇḍa, Bhūdhara, and Abhayā located on the back,
Surasā, Vajramuṣṭi, the letter Ba is the first one, and also the letter Bha,

analyzed: viśvamūrtiḥ dvis aṇḍa īśaḥ nidrā nābhi gataḥ tathā
translated: Viśvamūrti, Dviraṇḍeśa, Nidrā located in the navel,

analyzed: bhṛkuṭī ca bharadvājaḥ bhakāraḥ ca bhayāvahaḥ
translated: Bhṛkuṭī, Bharadvāja, the letter Bha, and the frightening one,
The letter Ma is the last one, and also the letter Ya.

analyzed: vaikuṇṭhaḥ ca mahākālaḥ tandrī intrī jaṭhara saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Vaikuṇṭha, Mahākāla, Tandrī located in the belly,

original: mantreśo maṇḍalo mānī viṣaṃ sūryo makārakaḥ // //
translated: Mantreśa, Maṇḍala, Mānin, poison, the sun, and the letter Ma,

original: kṣudhā vāṇī ca vāyustvag hṛdgataḥ puruṣottamaḥ /
analyzed: kṣudhā vāṇī ca vāyuḥ tvac hṛd gataḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: Hunger, speech, wind, skin, and Puruṣottama located in the heart,

analyzed: yamunā yāmuneyaḥ ca yakāraḥ ma antimaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Yamunā, Yāmuneya, the letter Ya is remembered as the last one,

analyzed: krodhinī ca bhujaṅgeśaḥ bālī rudhira pāvakau
translated: Krodhinī, Bhujaṅgeśa, Bāli, Rudhira, and Pāvaka,

analyzed: rociṣmān dakṣiṇa aṃśaḥ ca ruciraḥ rephaḥ īritaḥ
translated: Rocismat, Dakshinasha, Rucira, and Repha are said to be the letters of the Re group.

analyzed: kriyā kakudaḥ māṃsam ca pinākī bhūḥ balānujaḥ
translated: Kriya, Kakuda, Mamsa, Pinaki, Bhu, Balanuja,
Lampata, Shakra, and Vayavya are said to be the letters of the La group.

analyzed: hṛutkārī jalasaṃjñaḥ ca caṇḍīśaḥ api vakārakaḥ
translated: Hri, Karin, Jalasamjna, and Chandisha are said to be the letters of the Va group.

analyzed: mṛtyuḥ vakaḥ vṛviṣa ghnaḥ ca hṛdaḥ dakṣa kara sthitaḥ
śaṅkha aṅku karṇa usthi saṃjñaḥ ca śakāraḥ vidbhiḥ īritaḥ
translated: Shankha, Kukarna, Asthisamjna, and Shakara are said to be the letters of the Sha group by the knowers of the Vedas.

original: vṛṣaḥ śveteśvaraḥ pītā majjā tṛḍ vāmabāhugaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣaḥ śveteśvaraḥ pītā majjā tṛṣ vāma bāhu gaḥ
translated: Vrisha, Shvetisha, Pita, Majja, Trishna, Vamabahu,

analyzed: ṣaṣ ānanaḥ ṣaṣ ākāraḥ ṣakāraḥ kīrtitaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: Sadanana, Sadakara, and Shakara are said to be the letters of the Sha group by the wise.

analyzed: bhṛguḥ śvetaḥ tathā haṃsaḥ hṛdaḥ dakṣiṇa pāda gaḥ
translated: Bhrigu, Shveta, and Hamsa are located in the right foot of the heart.

original: samayaḥ sāmagaḥ śukraḥ saṅgatiḥ sārṇakaḥ śaśī // //
analyzed: samayaḥ sāmagaḥ śukraḥ saṅgatiḥ sārṇakaḥ śaśī
translated: Samaya, Samaga, Shukra, Sangati, Sarnaka, and Shashi are said to be the letters of the Sa group.

original: nabho varāho nakulī hṛdo vāmapadaḥ sthitaḥtiḥ /
analyzed: nabhaḥ varāhaḥ nakulī hṛdaḥ vāma padaḥ
translated: Nabha, Varaha, Nakuli, and Hrid are located in the left foot.
Sadashiva, Aruna, Prana, Hayagriva, and Haya are said to be the letters of the Ha group.
Shiva, Kavimala, and Asita are located from the heart to the navel.

analyzed: laghu prayatnaḥ ca upāntya ūtyaḥ lakāraḥ procyate budhaiḥ
translated: And the penultimate letter pronounced with light effort is said to be the letter la by the wise.

analyzed: saṃvartakaḥ nṛsiṃhaḥ ca hṛdayāt mukha saṃsthitaḥ
translated: The one who causes dissolution, Narasimha, is located in the heart and face.
Ananta, the supreme self, and the one with a vajra body, the last one, is called kṣa.

original: atha kādimate proktāḥ śaṃkareṇa śivāṃ prati /
analyzed: atha kādi mate proktāḥ śaṃkareṇa śivām prati
translated: Now, in the Kādīmata, Śaṅkara has spoken to Śivā:

analyzed: akāra ādi kṣakāra antāḥ varṇa saṃjñāḥ kramāt bruve
translated: I shall tell the names of the letters from a to kṣa in order.

analyzed: vātaḥ marut ca agni vahni dharā kṣmā jala vāriṇī
translated: Wind, air, fire, fire-bearing, earth, water, water-bearing,

original: vibhuḥ khañca caraḥ śucirbhūrvanaṃ svaña śaktiyuk // //
analyzed: vibhuḥ khañ ca caraḥ śuciḥ bhūḥ vanam svañ śaktiyuj
translated: the all-pervading, space, moving, pure, earth, forest, having the suffix a, endowed with power.

original: prāṇastejaḥ sthirā vārdyurvāyuścāpi prabhā ca jayā /🔽kamabhra / nādadāvau ca kuḥ pātho vyomato rayaḥ // //🔽śikhī gotrā toyaśūnye javī dyutī rabhismṛtaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ tejaḥ sthirāḥ vārdyuḥ vāyuḥ ca api prabhā ca jayā  kam abhra ca kuḥ pāthaḥ vyomataḥ rayaḥ   śikhī gotrā toyaśūnye javī
translated: Life, energy, firm, water, long life, and also wind, and also radiance, and also victory,🔽cloud, sound, giving, and the letter ku, water, sky, wealth.🔽Fire, family, devoid of water, swift, light, is said to be ra.

original: bhūmī raso nabhaścaiva vyāptaṃ dāho rasā'mbu ca // //
analyzed: bhūmiḥ rasaḥ nabhaḥ ca eva vyāptam dāhaḥ rasa ambu ca
translated: Earth, essence, and also space, pervaded, burning, essence, and water.

original: viyat sparśaśca hṛddhaṃsaḥ ilā grāsaḥ kramāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: viyat sparśaḥ ca hṛd haṃsaḥ ilā grāsaḥ kramāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Space, touch, in the heart, goose, earth, mouthful, the measures are remembered.

analyzed: mātṛkā varṇa saṃjñāḥ tu tāḥ jñātvā ca uddharet manūn
translated: These are the names of the letters of the alphabet. Knowing them, one should extract the mantras.
Having looked at many texts, by the wise Mahīdāsa,

analyzed: mātṛkā akṣara saṃjñā iyam sva para buddhaye
translated: This is the designation of the letters of the alphabet, for the understanding of oneself and others.

analyzed: iti śrīmat mahīdāsa viracita mātṛkānighaṇṭuḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Mātṛkā-nighantu composed by the venerable Mahīdāsa.

analyzed: ayam tāvat varṇa saṃjñā uddhāra prakāraḥ
translated: This is the method of extracting the names of the letters.

analyzed: dhruvaḥ tāraḥ tathā oṅkāraḥ mūlajyotiḥ śivaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: The fixed star, the melody, the syllable oṃ, the primordial light, Śiva, the imperishable one,

analyzed: veda ādyaḥ tārakaḥ vyaktaḥ śākhā ādiḥ praṇavaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The first of the Vedas, the star, the unmanifest, the first of the branches, is known as Pranava.

analyzed: mātṛkā ādyaḥ svara ādyaḥ ca śrīkaṇṭhaḥ keśavaḥ laghuḥ
translated: The first of the alphabet, the first of the vowels, Shrikantha, Keshava, Laghava,

original: kalādyaḥ keśavaḥ kṛṣṇo bhūteśaḥ prathamo bhavet // //
analyzed: kalā ādyaḥ keśavaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ bhūteśaḥ prathamaḥ bhavet
translated: The first of the Kalas, Keshava, Krishna, the Lord of the Bhutas, should be the first.

analyzed: hṛd tārakaḥ guruḥ dīrghaḥ nārāyaṇa caturmukhau
translated: The heart, the star, the guru, the long one, Narayana, the four-faced one,

analyzed: anantaḥ vāsudevaḥ ca vedāntaḥ kārakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Ananta, Vasudeva, Vedanta, the doer, is known as the first.
The right eye, Madhava, the subtle one, Panchjanya, the sprout of the sacrifice,

original: viḍ binduḥ parameśaśca gandharvaḥ paramaḥ smṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: viś binduḥ parameśaḥ ca gandharvaḥ paramaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The drop of the essence, the supreme lord, the gandharva, is known as the supreme.

analyzed: vāma akṣiḥ ca trimūrtiḥ ca mahāmāyā sureśvaraḥ
translated: The left eye, the three forms, the great illusion, the lord of the gods,

analyzed: indra mūrtiḥ nṛsiṃha astram smṛtaḥ govindaḥ īsvaraḥ
translated: The form of Indra, the Narasimha weapon, Govinda, the lord, is remembered.

analyzed: yāmyakarṇa umareśaḥ ca manmathaḥ utha gajāṅkuśaḥ
translated: The right ear, the lord of the immortals, the god of love, the elephant goad,
The victorious one, the remover of obstacles, Vishnu, is known as the first.

analyzed: vāmakarṇaḥ utha vāmāṃsaḥ dīrghaḥ ca madhusūdanaḥ
translated: The left ear, the left shoulder, the long one, the slayer of Madhu,

analyzed: indracāpaḥ utha sūkṣman ca ṣaṇmukhaḥ ṣaṭsvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The rainbow, the subtle one, the six-faced one, is known as the six-toned one.
The right nostril, the three-stepped one, the bearer of the burden, the lord of the planets, the lord of the planets,

analyzed: ṛc mūrtiḥ tu yati ṛsvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The form of the Rig Veda is known as the enemy-destroying ascetic, the lord of the Vedas.

analyzed: vāmanāsā atithi īśaḥ ca śrīkaṇṭhaḥ tripurāntakaḥ
translated: The guest of the left nostril, the lord of guests, Srikantha, the destroyer of Tripura,

analyzed: amrteśaḥ svaraḥ sthāṇuḥ devajukaḥ oṣṭasvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The lord of nectar, the vowel, Sthanu, the divine sage, is remembered as the eighth vowel.
Sthanu is situated in the right cheek, Hrishikesha is the god of three,

analyzed: ekāṅghriḥ vajradaṇḍaḥ ca vyomādrī ḷsvaraḥ smṛtaḥ  p
translated: Ekangri, Vajrada, and Vyomadri are remembered as the vowels.

original: vāmagaṇḍodarārddheca padmanābhaḥ kuberadṛk /🔽gaṇeśaśca trikaṇṭhaśca nīlāṅghrirdaśamaḥ svaraḥ // //
analyzed: vāma gaṇḍa udara arddhe ca padmanābhaḥ kubera dṛś  gaṇeśaḥ ca trikaṇṭhaḥ ca nīlāṅghriḥ daśamaḥ svaraḥ
translated: The left cheek, belly, and half are Padma, Kubera's eye,🔽Ganesa, Trikantha, Nila, and Anghri are the tenth vowel.
The upper hand, the elephant light, Damodara, the triangle,

analyzed: jhiṇṭīśaḥ kāmarūpaḥ ca śaktiḥ ekārakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Jhanti, Kama, and Shakti are remembered as the vowel E.

original: adho dharendravāgīśā vāsudevo'tha bhautikaḥ /🔽traipuraḥ praṇato varmamarutau dvādaśasvaraḥ // //
analyzed: adhas dharā indra vāc īśāḥ vāsudeva utha bhautikaḥ  traipuraḥ praṇataḥ varma marutau dvādaśa svaraḥ
translated: Below are the lords of the earth, speech, and Vasudeva, then Bhautika,🔽Tripura, the bowed one, the armor, and the two Maruts are the twelfth vowel.

analyzed: ūrdhva danta ali jaḥ sadyas saṅkarṣaṇaḥ tri mātrakaḥ
translated: Born from the upper teeth, Sadya, Sankarshana, the three-matra,

analyzed: mantreśaḥ naga saṃjñaḥ ca mātreśaḥ tu osvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Mantresha, the mountain-named, and Matresha are remembered as the vowel O.

analyzed: adhodanta anilaḥ mitraḥ pradyumnaḥ anugraha īśvaraḥ
translated: The wind from the lower teeth, Mitra, Pradyumna, the benefactor,

analyzed: nṛsiṃha ākhyaḥ murāriḥ ca māyāvid causvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The one called Nṛsiṃha, the enemy of Mura, and the one skilled in illusion, is remembered as the vowel A.

analyzed: ūrdhva dantaḥ ca aniruddhaḥ haraḥ bhānuḥ svaraḥ śaśī
translated: The one with the upper teeth, Aniruddha, Hara, the sun, the vowel A, the moon,

analyzed: manaḥ ca anaṅga kavacau nigūḍhaḥ aṃsvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The mind, the one with the body armor of Kāma, and the hidden one, is remembered as the vowel A.

analyzed: kārtikeyaḥ uniruddhaḥ ca śilpābhijñaḥ ramā api ca
translated: Kārttikeya, Aniruddha, the one skilled in arts, Ramā,

original: sṛṣṭiḥ saṃhārakartā ca viṣaṃ ca aḥsvaraḥ smṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: sṛṣṭiḥ saṃhāra kartā ca viṣam ca aḥsvaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The creator, the destroyer, and poison, is remembered as the vowel A.
The one with the right ear and so on, the angry one, Vāyu, the fire, the club, the pain,

analyzed: yādaveśaḥ murāriḥ ca kāmāṅgaḥ kārṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The one possessed by Yādava, the enemy of Mura, the one with the body of Kāma, and the one with the body of Kāma, is remembered as the vowel A.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa kūrparaḥ kheṭaḥ śārṅgī caṇḍīśakaḥ khagaḥ
translated: The one on the right elbow, the club, the one with the Śārṅga bow, the lord of Caṇḍī, the bird,

analyzed: kaiṭabhāriḥ ca mātaṅgaḥ saṃhāraḥ khārṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The enemy of Kaiṭabha, the elephant, the destroyer, is remembered as the vowel A.
The one situated at the wrist, the lion, the lord of the group of five, the destroyer,

analyzed: gomukhaḥ gajakumbhaḥ ca halīśaḥ ca gajānanaḥ
translated: The one with the face of an elephant, the plow, the lord of the plow, and the elephant-faced one,

analyzed: aṅgulī mūla gaḥ meghaḥ muṣalī ca śiva uttamaḥ
translated: The one at the root of the finger, the cloud, the one with the mace, the excellent Śiva,

analyzed: varāhaḥ dhanakāmaḥ ca śivāghaḥ gha arṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ  p
translated: The boar, the one desiring wealth, Śivā, the one with the body of a ghost, is remembered as the vowel A.

analyzed: dakṣa aṅguli agra gaḥ śūlī klība ākhyaḥ ca eva rudrakaḥ
translated: The one at the tip of the right finger, the trident, and the one called Klib, and Rudra,

original: ḍāmareśo hariḥ śrīmān rudreśo ṅāṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ // //
translated: Hari is glorious Damarésa, and Rudresá is remembered as Nánaka.

original: nā cāmarādikaḥ kūrmaḥ śūlī candrakasāyakau /🔽bhūbhettā citracārī ca cañcalaścārṇako mataḥ // //
analyzed: nā cāmara ādikaḥ kūrmaḥ śūlī candraka sāyakau  bhūbhettā citracārī ca cañcalaḥ ca arṇakaḥ mataḥ
translated: Ná, Amára, etc., are Kúrma, and the trident-bearer is the crescent moon and the arrow.🔽The conqueror of the earth, the variegated performer, the restless, and the letter A are considered.

analyzed: vāma kūrpara gaḥ pāśī paripūrṇa eka netrakau
translated: The noose is on the left elbow, and the two eyes are completely filled.

original: tribinduko jvarī vāmā śleṣakaśchārṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ // //🔽vāmamaṇibandhagataścaturmukho jayantakaḥ /
analyzed: vāma maṇibandha gataḥ catur mukhaḥ jayantakaḥ
translated: The three dots, the fever, the left, and the letter Cha are remembered as the combiner.🔽The four-faced one on the left wrist is Jayántaka.

original: japajyotiranākāro janaka uta jārṇakaḥ // //🔽aṅgulīmūlagaḥ khaṇḍaḥ kumudaḥ svastikaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: japajyotiḥ an ākāraḥ janakaḥ uta jārṇakaḥ  /
translated: The mantra light, the formless, the producer, and the letter Ja are considered.🔽The one at the base of the finger is Khánda, and Kumuda is remembered as the svastika.
The well-known one, the stable form, the jingling sound, and the letter Jha are considered.

original: vāmāṅgulyagragaḥ somo nando vidviḍ nirañjanaḥ /🔽sudharmo hyanunāsaśca jñaptigo ñārṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ // //🔽dakṣapādādigo nandī lāṅgalī cārddhacandrakaḥ /
analyzed: sudharmaḥ hi anunāsaḥ ca jñaptigaḥ ña arṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The moon on the tip of the left finger is Nanda, the non-attached, the stainless,🔽and the nasal sound is remembered as the letter ña.
Nándi, the plough, the half-moon, the elephant goad, and the deer-marked are remembered as the letter ṭa.
The lord of half a woman, born of Mars, the divine leader, is on the right ankle.

original: sudhābindurghaṭākāraḥ plāvakaṣṭhārṇako mataḥ // //🔽yāmyajānusthito daṇḍo dāruko vatsalo naraḥ /
analyzed: sudhā binduḥ ghaṭa ākāraḥ plāva kaṣṭha arṇakaḥ mataḥ
translated: The syllable gha is considered to be the form of a pot filled with nectar, and the syllable ka is considered to be the wood to be floated.

original: ḍāmaro vyāghrapādaśca śūlī strī ḍāṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ // //🔽yāmyapādāṅgulī pūrṇo'pyumākāntastathā hariḥ /
analyzed: ḍāmaraḥ vyāghrapādaḥ ca śūlī strī ḍāṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ  yāmya pāda aṅgulī pūrṇaḥ upi umākāntaḥ tathā hariḥ
translated: The staff located on the right knee is called daru, the affectionate man is called vatsala, the drum is called dāmara, the tiger's foot is called vyāghrapāda, the trident is called śūlī, and the woman is called ḍāṇakā.

original: śaṅkhanābhirdṛḍhaṃ loho dāhakau ḍhāṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ // //🔽yāmyapādāṅgulāgrastha āṣāḍhīśastrivikramaḥ /
analyzed: śaṅkhanābhiḥ dṛḍham lohaḥ dāhakau ḍhāṇakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The one full in the toe of the right foot is called Umākānta, the one like Hari is called Hari, the conch navel is called Śaṅkhanābhi, the firm metal is called Dṛḍha, the two burners are called Dhāka, and the one remembered as Ḍhāṇaka.

analyzed: tri rekhaḥ triguṇa ākāraḥ nirvāṇaḥ ṇa arṇakaḥ mataḥ  p  vāma pāda ādikaḥ tīvraḥ
translated: The one located at the tip of the toe of the right foot is called Āṣāḍhīśa, the one with three strides is called Trivikrama, the one with three lines is called Trirekhā, the one with the form of the three qualities is called Triguṇākāra, and the one extinguished is considered to be the syllable ṇa.

original: nīlako'pyarthako dhātā taḍit tu tārṇako mataḥ // //🔽vāmajānurviśālākṣī śaurī dṛg vai kamaṇḍaluḥ /
analyzed: dhātā taḍit tu tārṇakaḥ mataḥ  / vāma jānuḥ viśāla akṣī śaurī   vai kamaṇḍaluḥ
translated: The one beginning with the left foot is called Tīvra, the one with the feet of elephants, horses, and donkeys is called Hastyaśvataralopāṅghrika, the one with a blue color is called Nīlaka, the one with a purpose is called Artha, the creator is called Dhātā, and the lightning is considered to be the syllable ṭa.

original: sūcīpurasthirasthāyī sthavirasthārṇako mataḥ // //🔽vāmagulphasthitaḥ śūlī dātrī dātā kuberakaḥ /
analyzed: vāma gulpha sthitaḥ śūlī dātrī dātā kuberakaḥ
translated: The left knee is called Viśālākṣī, the one with the eyes of Śauri is called Śaurī, the one with the eyes of Kamaṇḍalu is called Kamandalu, the one residing in the city of Sūcī is called Sthira, the one residing in Sthavira is considered to be the syllable ṭha.

The one located on the left ankle is called Śūlī, the one who cuts is called Dātrī, the one who gives is called Kubera, the one with the moon is called Candraka, the one with turmeric is called Haridrānta, and the lord of gods is remembered as the syllable ḍha.

analyzed: ṭhakāraḥ lāṅgalī ca eva dakṣa ūru ūru vartulaḥ punar
translated: Tha is the ploughman, the right thigh, and the round one again.

analyzed: pūrṇa candra amṛta ākhyau ca tathā kara tala dvayam
translated: Pūrṇacandra and Amṛta, and also the two palms,

original: vanajo jīvano jīvo vṛṣaghnaścandrakaḥ sudhā // ṭha // //🔽p /
analyzed: vanajaḥ jīvanaḥ jīvaḥ vṛṣaghnaḥ candrakaḥ sudhā  p
translated: Vana, Jīvana, Jīva, Vṛṣaghna, Candraka, Sudhā, Ṭha,🔽Ḍa,
Ḍa is said to be Dāruka, the right knee, and Pālaka,

original: vāmabāhuśca kaumārī tathā vai yoginīpriyaḥ // ḍa // //
analyzed: vāma bāhuḥ ca kaumārī tathā vai yoginīpriyaḥ
translated: The left arm, Kaumārī, and also Yoginipriya, Ḍa,🔽Ḍha,

analyzed: ḍhakāraḥ api ardhanārīśaḥ dakṣajaṅgha abhidhaḥ tathā
translated: Ḍha is also Ardhanārīśa, and also known as the right thigh,
Vināyaka, the giver of accomplishments, Vighneśa, the right-armed one, Ḍha,🔽Ṇa,

analyzed: ṇakāraḥ ca umākāntaḥ dakṣapāda abhidhaḥ tathā
translated: Ṇa is also Umākānta, and also known as the right foot,

original: nārāyaṇo dvinetraśca tathā vai yoginā / priyaḥ // ṇa // //
analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ dvi netraḥ ca tathā vai yoginā priyaḥ
translated: Nārāyaṇa, the two-eyed one, and also dear to the yogis, Ṇa,🔽Ta,

analyzed: tamāṭaḥ ṣāṭiḥ vāma sphic tāra ākhyaḥ ūrdhva jānukaḥ
translated: Tamāṭa, Ṣāṭi, the left buttock, known as Tārā, the upper knee,

analyzed: śaktī śaktiḥ jaṭā ca eva tārakaḥ madhyakarṇakaḥ
translated: Śakti, Śakti, and the matted hair, Tāraka, the middle ear, Ta,🔽Tha,

original: thaḥ strī vāsī bhayānakaḥ śilī śirasijastathā /
analyzed: strī vāsī bhayānakaḥ śilī śirasijaḥ tathā
translated: Tha is a woman, Vāsī, Bhayanaka, Śilī, and the head hair,

analyzed: dodrīśaḥ vāmajānuḥ ca dātā dhātā ca dhātakiḥ

analyzed: kuṇḍalam dakṣapādaḥ ca tathā dharma abhidhāyakaḥ

analyzed: dhakāraḥ vāmajaṅghā ca priyaḥ ca darśanaḥ tathā
translated: The letter Dha is on the left shank, and Priya (beloved) and Darsana (vision) are likewise.

analyzed: netra yugmam ca saṃjñā ca sthāṇuḥ asthāṇuḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: The pair of eyes, the designation, Sthanu (immobile), Asthanu (mobile), and Isvara (Lord) are also there.

analyzed: na u meṣaḥ vāma pādaḥ ca anādiḥ nīlaḥ ca vāmanaḥ
translated: The letter Na is on the left foot, the beginningless one, the blue one, and the dwarf.

analyzed: danturaḥ ca ūrdhva vāsī ca naradevaḥ nirañjanaḥ na
translated: The one with protruding teeth, the one dwelling above, the god of men, and the stainless one are also there.

analyzed: nidhiḥ śeṣaḥ guhya kartā tapanaḥ pañcamaḥ tathā
translated: The treasure, the remaining one, the secret doer, the scorching one, and the fifth one.

translated: The heroic Bhadra, Savitri, the night of destruction, and the destroyer of the enemy are also there.🔽The letter Pha is on the left side, the one with a peacock's tail, the one with a peacock's voice, and the left foot.

original: nīlapādastathā proktaḥ śikhī vai śākhināṃ priyaḥ // pha // //🔽baśchagaṇḍaḥ pṛṣṭhavaṃśaḥ śikhibāho yugandharaḥ /
analyzed: nīlapādaḥ tathā proktaḥ śikhī vai śākhinām priyaḥ  baḥ chagaṇḍaḥ pṛṣṭhavaṃśaḥ śikhibāhaḥ yugandharaḥ
translated: The blue foot is mentioned, and the one with a peacock's tail is dear to the tree-dwellers.🔽The letter Ba is on the back, the one with a peacock's neck, the one with a peacock's wings, and Yugandhara (the supporter of the yoke).

original: mukhabindurbalirghaṇṭī yoddhā trilocanapriyaḥ // ba // //🔽p / 🔽bho dviraṇḍo nābhibhadre bhīmo bhāṣaṇameva ca /
analyzed: mukha binduḥ baliḥ ghaṇṭī yoddhā trilocana priyaḥ  p  bho dvis aṇḍaḥ nābhibhadre bhīmaḥ bhāṣaṇam eva ca
translated: The face-drop, the offering, the bell, the warrior, and the one dear to the three-eyed one are also there.🔽The letter Bha is on the left shoulder, the one with two testicles, the one with a beautiful navel, the terrible one, and the one who speaks.

analyzed: dakṣaskandaḥ mahābāhuḥ bhramaraḥ tu jaya abhidhaḥ
translated: The right shoulder, the mighty-armed one, the bee, and the one named Jaya are also there.
Mahākālī, known as the ocean, Kāla, the destroyer of poison,

original: kṛtāntaḥ kṛdhiṣitaḥ puṃso yamaśca kālabhadrakaḥ // ma // //🔽yaḥ kṛtīśo yugāntaśca bālīśo vāyusaṃjñakaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtāntaḥ puṃsaḥ yamaḥ ca kālabhadrakaḥ  yaḥ kṛtīśaḥ yuga antaḥ ca bālīśaḥ vāyu saṃjñakaḥ
translated: Kṛtānta, Kṛdhiṣita, the lord of men, Yama, and Kālabhadraka,🔽The one who is Kṛtīśa, Yugaṃta, Bālīśa, and known as Vāyu,

translated: Ro, Bhujaṅga, Dhāturatta, Sūrya, and Veda,

nṛsiṃha astram śānti māye govindaḥ ca sureśvaraḥ

analyzed: nādabindu samāyuktaḥ bījam prāthamikam smṛtam hrīṃ

क्रोधीश (angry lord), mounted on क्षतज (blood), adorned with धूम्रभैरवी,
united with नाद and बिन्दु, is known as residing in पितृभूमि (land of the manes).

United with नाद and बिन्दु, taking on the yoga of समयाग्रभैरवी (the foremost Bhairavi of the Samaya vow),

analyzed: bījam etat tu kathitam śuddha buddhi pravartakam aim
translated: this seed mantra is said to be the instigator of pure intellect.
क्रोधीश (angry lord), बलभिद् (conqueror of Bala), धूम्रभैरवी (dark Bhairavi), नाद (sound) and बिन्दु (dot) -

analyzed: trimūrtiḥ manmathaḥ kāmarājaḥ tri ailokya mohanam klīṃ

analyzed: indrāsana gataḥ brahmā sa trimūrtiḥ tu manmathaḥ klīṃ
translated: Brahma seated on Indra's throne, and Manmatha with three forms, Klim.

analyzed: nādabindu samāyuktam kiṅkiṇī bījam uttamam drīṃ

translated: Endowed with nada and bindu, residing in blood, the food of oblations,🔽Accompanied by the seat of Kalaratri, the great mantra of the arrow, Drum.

analyzed: vidārī āliṅgitaḥ guhye valibhuj kṣataja ukṣitaḥ
translated: Embraced by Vidari in the secret place, the eater of oblations, smeared with blood,

analyzed: nādabindu samāyuktaḥ vijñeyaḥ piśita aśanaḥ drūṃ
